original: 'di la shes pa gzhan la dngos gzhi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la shes pa gzhan la dngos gzhi 'byung ba'o //
translated: In this case, the other consciousnesses arise as the actual basis.🔽

original: rjes su spro ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rjes su spro ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is incurred when one is enthusiastic about it.

original: gzhan nye bar gnas pa ni tshig kyal pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nye bar gnas pa ni tshig kyal pa tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the offense of idle chatter is incurred when someone else is present.

original: log par ston pa'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: log par ston pa'i ltung byed do //
translated: The downfall of misrepresenting one’s level of spiritual attainment.

original: gang la mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of being unstable and changing like a chameleon?

original: de'i phyir khro bas bdag nyid la gnod par byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gnod pa byed pa'i sgra ni rdeg pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khro bas bdag nyid la gnod par byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te / gnod pa byed pa'i sgra ni rdeg pa la'o //
translated: The root text states, “When, out of anger, one harms oneself.”🔽The term “harms” here refers to beating oneself.

original: bdag nyid la gnod par byed ces bya ba'i rnam par 'byed pa ni rdeg par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gnod par byed ces bya ba'i rnam par 'byed pa ni rdeg par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “harms oneself” in the root text is a reference to “beating oneself.”

original: mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di yin te /
translated: The downfall of being unstable and changing like a chameleon is as follows.

original: de bas na mi brtan pa rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kyis 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi brtan pa rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kyis 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “one is unstable and changes like a chameleon.”

original: mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: mi brtan pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of being unstable and changing like a chameleon.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni bla mar gyur pa la brnyas thabs byed pa'i ltung byed gsum ston te /
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni bla mar gyur pa la brnyas thabs byed pa'i ltung byed gsum ston te /
translated: Now, from here on, it teaches the three downfalls of disrespecting those who are gurus.

original: de rnams kyi dang po ni dge slong ma'i tshogs pa la brnyas thabs byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dang po ni dge slong ma'i tshogs pa la brnyas thabs byed pa la'o //
translated: The first of those is disrespecting a group of nuns.

original: tshogs kyi sgra ni dge 'dun 'di dang 'og ma la'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgra ni dge 'dun 'di dang 'og ma la'o //
translated: The word “group” is used for the Saṅgha here and below.

original: dge slong ma'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'byed pa ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'byed pa ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The analysis called “a group of nuns” is stated as “a Saṅgha of nuns.”

original: gsum mam gnyis sam gcig po rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs pas nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum mam gnyis sam gcig po rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs pas nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that following three, two, or one of them is a fault.

original: brnyas thabs byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di rnam par 'byed pa ni brnyas thabs byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: brnyas thabs byed pa zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di rnam par 'byed pa ni brnyas thabs byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: The analysis of this sūtra called “disrespect” is “also for disrespect.”

original: de bas na 'dir brnyas thabs byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir brnyas thabs byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, here “also for disrespect” is stated.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis smon par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis smon par byed de /
translated: One makes a request in various ways.

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal gyis 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal gyis 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: He lives by hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, and by seeking gain from gain.

original: mig sal ba rmongs pa mi mkhas pa yin no //🔽ltung ba @44a * //
analyzed: mig sal ba rmongs pa mi mkhas pa yin no // ltung ba @44a * //
translated: He is blind, confused, and unskilled.

original: yang mi shes ltung ba med pa yang mi shes pa yin no //🔽'di la byin pa'am byas pa'am /
analyzed: yang mi shes ltung ba med pa yang mi shes pa yin no // 'di la byin pa'am byas pa'am /
translated: He does not know the offenses, nor does he know the non-offenses.

original: bsnyen bkur kun du spyad pas ci bya /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur kun du spyad pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of giving to him, or of doing for him, or of serving him?🔽He is entangled in wrong views.

original: log pa'i chos kyis kun tu dkris pa yin no zhes gleng gzhi las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i chos kyis kun tu dkris pa yin no zhes gleng gzhi las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said in the nidana.

original: de bas na 'di lta bu'i brnyas thabs byed pa la yang 'di'i ngo bo zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta bu'i brnyas thabs byed pa la yang 'di'i ngo bo zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even when treated with such contempt, one should understand that this is his nature.

original: gang la bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the second basis of training should be stated.

original: de'i phyir spyo ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyo ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: Even when scolded.

original: dge slong ma'i tshogs la zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshogs la zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras smos so //
translated: Even is stated to connect it with a group of nuns.

original: dge slong ma'i tshogs la spyod par byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshogs la spyod par byed pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The story of the group of nuns is as follows.

original: 'dir 'tsho ba'i phyir mgo bregs pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'tsho ba'i phyir mgo bregs pa /
translated: Here, one who shaves the head for a living,

original: mu ge'i phyir mgo bregs pa /
analyzed: mu ge'i phyir mgo bregs pa /
translated: one who shaves the head for famine,

original: sdig pa'i las can /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las can /
translated: one who is sinful,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa /
translated: one who is not noble,

original: zol pa mo //
analyzed: zol pa mo //
translated: one who is deceitful,

original: pha rol slu ba yang dag par sdom pa ma yin pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol slu ba yang dag par sdom pa ma yin pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: one who deceives others, one who is not restrained, one who has faulty morality.

original: de bas na spyod ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di rnams yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas na spyod ba'i rang bzhin ni 'di rnams yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, one should understand that these are the natures of the faults.

original: / spyo ba'i tshig 'di rnams la don tha dad pa nyid de log pa'i 'tsho ba'i khongs su tshul khrims 'chal ba bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / spyo ba'i tshig 'di rnams la don tha dad pa nyid de log pa'i 'tsho ba'i khongs su tshul khrims 'chal ba bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These words of reproach have a different meaning, because faulty morality is included in the category of wrong livelihood.

original: de bas na tha dad pa'i nges pa ni sems tha dad pa'i dbang gis tshig la'o //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa'i nges pa ni sems tha dad pa'i dbang gis tshig la'o //
translated: Therefore, the certainty of difference is due to the power of different minds, and the words are different.

original: de bas na brnyas thabs dang spyod ba dag la don tha dad pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o//
analyzed: de bas na brnyas thabs dang spyod ba dag la don tha dad pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o//
translated: Therefore, one should understand that contempt and reproach have a different meaning.

original: gang la bslab pa'i gzhi gsum pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la bslab pa'i gzhi gsum pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the third basis of training should be stated.

original: de'i phyir 'khor gtso bo la chus 'thor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor gtso bo la chus 'thor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with water on the principal retinue.”

original: 'khor gtso bo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: 'khor gtso bo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The term “principal retinue”

original: 'dir dge slong la brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir dge slong la brjod do //
translated: refers here to a monk.

original: 'khor gtso bo zhes bya ba rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gtso bo zhes bya ba rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Vibhāṣā says, “The principal retinue is a monk.”

original: lus la thigs pa tsam gyis phog par gyur na yang de'i tshe chus gtor ba yin no //
analyzed: lus la thigs pa tsam gyis phog par gyur na yang de'i tshe chus gtor ba yin no //
translated: Even if just a drop of water touches the body, then at that time there is sprinkling with water.

original: brgyal ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni dge slong brgyal ba la chu gtor ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: brgyal ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni dge slong brgyal ba la chu gtor ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who is unconscious.

original: kha na mtho ba 'di ni log par bsgrub par gyur pa'i gtong ba la zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba 'di ni log par bsgrub par gyur pa'i gtong ba la zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This offense is known as “abandonment through wrong practice.”

original: dge slong la thu zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong la thu zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not say “sir” to a monk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here the text

original: phran tshegs rnams las thu zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i dang po 'di nas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phran tshegs rnams las thu zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i dang po 'di nas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: says, “The first is taught in the Kṣudraka Collection, ‘One should not say “sir.”’”

original: rab tu byung ba 'di pa la spyod bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i tshogs la spyod ba'i ltung byed sngar logs shig tu bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di pa la spyod bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i tshogs la spyod ba'i ltung byed sngar logs shig tu bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not engage in this Dharma means that the offense of engaging in this Dharma is already explained separately in the Bhikshuni Vibhanga.

original: @44b chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba dge slong la sogs pa la chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba'i tshig gis bsdus te /
analyzed: @44b chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba dge slong la sogs pa la chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba'i tshig gis bsdus te /
translated: The Dharma of this Dharma is included in the words the going forth of this Dharma of the Bhikshus and so forth.

original: 'di la spyod ba la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la spyod ba la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Engaging in this is established as a fault.

original: lci ba'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir mgu bar spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: lci ba'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir mgu bar spyad pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not a heavy Dharma, it is engaging in pleasing.

original: mgu bar spyad pa zhes smos pas zla ba phyed spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mgu bar spyad pa zhes smos pas zla ba phyed spyad par bya'o //
translated: By mentioning engaging in pleasing, one should engage for half a month.

original: de la gnyis ka yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rab tu byung ba 'di pa de la spyo par mi ba'o zhes bya ba smos pa de la brnyas thabs dang spyod ba gnyis ka la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnyis ka yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rab tu byung ba 'di pa de la spyo par mi ba'o zhes bya ba smos pa de la brnyas thabs dang spyod ba gnyis ka la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: There, both are said to be both, meaning that one should not scold the one who has gone forth in this Dharma. In that, both contempt and engaging should be understood.

original: rab tu byung ba 'di pa la brnyas thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dis 'phangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di pa la brnyas thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dis 'phangs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This also implies the meaning of “one should not insult a renunciant.”

original: dge slong gi mdun du spyod yul du rgyu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du spyod yul du rgyu bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not walk in the activity range in front of a monk.🔽One should not go with a monk on a bridge that is not firm.

original: zam pa mi brtan par dge slong dang lhan cig 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni zam pa brtan pa dang mi ldeg pas ltung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi nyes dmigs mi srid pas na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zam pa mi brtan par dge slong dang lhan cig 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni zam pa brtan pa dang mi ldeg pas ltung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi nyes dmigs mi srid pas na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bridge is firm and does not collapse, and the danger of falling is not possible.

original: dge slong mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang bar bya'o //
translated: One should rise from one’s seat upon seeing a monk.

original: 'dug pas de 'greng bas ha cang yun ring du 'da' bar byed na stan la 'dug tu gzhug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dug pas de 'greng bas ha cang yun ring du 'da' bar byed na stan la 'dug tu gzhug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: If a monk is standing, one should invite him to sit if he is staying for a long time.

original: 'dug pas zhes bya ba ni stan la 'dug tu gzhug go zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'dug pas zhes bya ba ni stan la 'dug tu gzhug go zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
translated: “If he is sitting” is connected with “one should invite him to sit.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'o //
translated: “He” refers to a monk.

original: gnas skabs gang du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what situation does this occur?

original: de'i phyir 'greng ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'greng ba zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, “standing” is mentioned.

original: gnas pas zhes bya ba'i spyod lam gyis dus 'da' bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: gnas pas zhes bya ba'i spyod lam gyis dus 'da' bar byed pa la'o //
translated: One should pass the time in the posture called sitting, which is the posture for sitting.

original: gnas skabs ji lta bus de stan la 'dug tu gzhug ce na /
analyzed: gnas skabs ji lta bus de stan la 'dug tu gzhug ce na /
translated: In what state should one sit on the seat?

original: de'i phyir 'dug pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dug pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said sitting.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba yongs su gyur pa la byed pa po nyid kyi tshig gis 'brel to snyam du shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba yongs su gyur pa la byed pa po nyid kyi tshig gis 'brel to snyam du shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, in this case, the word bhikṣu is related by the word agent in the transformation of the bhikṣus should do this.

original: mi byed na 'dug pa'i phyir zhugs te de la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi byed na 'dug pa'i phyir zhugs te de la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one does not do it, one should sit down and sit there.

original: mi byed na zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma stan la 'dug par ma byas pa la /
analyzed: mi byed na zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma stan la 'dug par ma byas pa la /
translated: Here, if one does not do it means if the bhikṣu does not sit on the seat.

original: 'di la des 'dug pa la nges par sbyar ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la des 'dug pa la nges par sbyar ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means one should definitely apply oneself to sitting there.

original: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba nyid dge slong de'o //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba nyid dge slong de'o //
translated: As soon as one sees, it is the bhikṣu himself.

original: de la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis so //
analyzed: de la 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis so //
translated: One should sit there means the bhikṣu should.

original: zhus te zhes bya ba ni gnang na stan de la 'dug par bya ste /
analyzed: zhus te zhes bya ba ni gnang na stan de la 'dug par bya ste /
translated: Having asked means if one is permitted, one should sit on that seat.

original: dge slong mas zhes bya ba'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas zhes bya ba'i don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “bhikṣuṇī” should be understood.

original: bla mar gyur pa la brnyas thabs byed pa'i ltung byed gsum mo /🔽// / gang la 'khrug lang yal @45a * //
analyzed: bla mar gyur pa la brnyas thabs byed pa'i ltung byed gsum mo / // / gang la 'khrug lang yal @45a * //
translated: The third is the downfall of disrespecting a superior.

original: bar dor ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bar dor ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of abandoning a dispute?

original: de'i phyir dge slong ma rnams kyis rtsod pa mthu yod bzhin du nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong ma rnams kyis rtsod pa mthu yod bzhin du nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “If a bhikṣuṇī does not pacify a dispute when she has the power to do so.”

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i mthu yod bzhin du rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i mthu yod bzhin du rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar mi byed pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If she has the power to pacify a dispute but does not do so, she commits this downfall.

original: gal te gang gi tshe de'i 'og tu ma bral ba nyid la de'i sems la de dang 'brel pa rnam par nges pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe de'i 'og tu ma bral ba nyid la de'i sems la de dang 'brel pa rnam par nges pa'am /
translated: If, after that, she does not separate from the other, then her mind is definitely connected with the other.

original: bsam pa btang nas yang bsam pa gzhan bskyed pa ltung ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ma btang ba nyid la /
analyzed: bsam pa btang nas yang bsam pa gzhan bskyed pa ltung ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ma btang ba nyid la /
translated: If she gives up her intention, then she generates another intention.

original: ltung ba gcig pa nyid kyi bsam pa dor nas slar yang mngon par bsten pa la ltung byed gzhan bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba gcig pa nyid kyi bsam pa dor nas slar yang mngon par bsten pa la ltung byed gzhan bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having given up the thought of a single downfall, he again resorts to it, and so generates another downfall.

original: 'khrug long yal bar dor ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: 'khrug long yal bar dor ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: (The second downfall is) forsaking a dispute.

original: gang la blo mthun par mi byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la blo mthun par mi byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of not agreeing?

original: de'i phyir zhag lon pa'i mi 'dun pa sbyin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhag lon pa'i mi 'dun pa sbyin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “giving back the agreement after a day has passed.”

original: nyi ma snga ma gzhan la 'dun pa phul ba de nyid du yang yod pas /🔽'dun pa snga ma de gang gi phyir bdag gis dang du ma blangs pas yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: nyi ma snga ma gzhan la 'dun pa phul ba de nyid du yang yod pas / 'dun pa snga ma de gang gi phyir bdag gis dang du ma blangs pas yang ci'i phyir /
translated: The agreement offered on the previous day still exists,🔽so why does he say, “Because I did not accept the former agreement, why should I accept the agreement offered now?”

original: da ltar 'dun pa phul ba de bdag gis ma blangs so zhes zer zhing zag lon pa'i 'dun pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'dun pa phul ba de bdag gis ma blangs so zhes zer zhing zag lon pa'i 'dun pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: He gives back the agreement after a day has passed.

original: phyis nyi ma gzhan la 'dun pa sbyin pa la zhes bya ba 'dis bye brag pa nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis nyi ma gzhan la 'dun pa sbyin pa la zhes bya ba 'dis bye brag pa nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This shows the distinction of giving back the agreement on another day.

original: las gang la sbyin pa nyid de /
analyzed: las gang la sbyin pa nyid de /
translated: What is the action of giving it back?

original: de'i tshe las ma byas pa nyid la mdun du de'i las bya ba'i don slar bsdus pa'i rnam pa 'di la go skabs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe las ma byas pa nyid la mdun du de'i las bya ba'i don slar bsdus pa'i rnam pa 'di la go skabs so //
translated: At that time, the purpose of the act of gathering the Saṅgha in front of her for the purpose of performing the act of suspension was lost.

original: de ltar 'dir gleng gzhi ni sbo ma dga' mo la dge slong ma rnams kyis 'phags ma dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'tshogs kyis tshur shog cig ces byas pa dang / des smras pa chos bzhin du byed pa'i las la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir gleng gzhi ni sbo ma dga' mo la dge slong ma rnams kyis 'phags ma dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'tshogs kyis tshur shog cig ces byas pa dang / des smras pa chos bzhin du byed pa'i las la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: In this case, the introduction is that the bhikṣuṇīs said to Thullanandā, “Noble lady, the Saṅgha of bhikṣuṇīs is gathered. Come here.” She said, “I offer my assent to the act that is done in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: bya ba de yang ma byas so //
analyzed: bya ba de yang ma byas so //
translated: But that act was not done.🔽Again, the next day, the Saṅgha of bhikṣuṇīs gathered and admonished Thullanandā. When she would not come, the disciplinarian said, “Noble lady, do you not wish to offer your assent?” She said, “I have already offered my assent.”

original: yang phyi de nyin phar dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'dus nas sbom dga' mo la sbran pa dang / de 'ong du ma btub nas dge skos mos ci 'phags ma 'dun pa 'bul mi 'dod dam zhes smras pa dang / des smra pa kho mos 'dun pa phul zin to //
analyzed: yang phyi de nyin phar dge slong ma'i dge 'dun 'dus nas sbom dga' mo la sbran pa dang / de 'ong du ma btub nas dge skos mos ci 'phags ma 'dun pa 'bul mi 'dod dam zhes smras pa dang / des smra pa kho mos 'dun pa phul zin to //
translated: “When did you offer it?”

original: nam phul nyi ma snga ma la'o ;
analyzed: nam phul nyi ma snga ma la'o ;
translated: “The day before yesterday.”

original: /'phags mas zhag lon pa'i 'dun pa 'bul du rung ngam /
analyzed: /'phags mas zhag lon pa'i 'dun pa 'bul du rung ngam /
translated: “Is it proper for a noble lady to offer assent after a day has passed?”

original: des smras pa chag gam rdul tam ci nyes zhes zer ba las bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: des smras pa chag gam rdul tam ci nyes zhes zer ba las bcas pa yin no //
translated: He said, “What is wrong? Are you sick or dirty?”

original: blo mthun par mi byed pa'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: blo mthun par mi byed pa'i ltung byed do //
translated: It is a downfall to not act in accord with that.

original: blo mthun pa la rtse bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: blo mthun pa la rtse bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is a downfall because one does not act in accord with the minds of others.

original: lci ba'i chos la 'das pa'i ltung byed gsum dang / lci ba'i @45b chos dang 'brel pa'i ltung byed chos las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i ltung byed 'og ma bzhi po ste /
analyzed: lci ba'i chos la 'das pa'i ltung byed gsum dang / lci ba'i @45b chos dang 'brel pa'i ltung byed chos las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i ltung byed 'og ma bzhi po ste /
translated: The fourth class of downfalls consists of the three downfalls called “transgressing the rules of heavy offense” and the one called “transgressing the rules of heavy offense related to the Dharma.”🔽The first of these is to not receive instructions and further teachings from the monks every half month.

original: de rnams kyi dang po ni zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong rnams las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dag nyams su myong bar mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi nyin mo gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa nyams su myong bar🔽byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dang po ni zla ba phyed phyed cing dge slong rnams las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dag nyams su myong bar mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi nyin mo gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa nyams su myong bar byas pa nyid do //
translated: This means that on the day of the purification practice, one must receive instructions and further teachings.

original: de bas na gso sbyong gi nyin mo las 'das na kha na ma tho ba 'di skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gso sbyong gi nyin mo las 'das na kha na ma tho ba 'di skyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one transgresses this rule on the day of the purification practice, one incurs this downfall.

original: rkyen byung na so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen byung na so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the experience of the individual is not a condition.

original: nyams su myong ba ni las nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni las nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: And experience is not not karma.

original: gso sbyong gi dus kyang 'di'i dus so //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi dus kyang 'di'i dus so //
translated: The time of the poṣadha is also its time.

original: de lta bas na 'dir nyi ma 'char ba'i dus las 'da' bar byed na 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di la na smad pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir nyi ma 'char ba'i dus las 'da' bar byed na 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di la na smad pa 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, when one passes beyond the time of the rising of the sun here, it is called “passed beyond” and the censure applies.

original: gnyis pa ni gang la dge slong dag med par gso sbyong byed pa la'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang la dge slong dag med par gso sbyong byed pa la'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The second is when the poṣadha is performed without bhikṣus.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis sngar dge 'dun las 'dun pa'i gso sbyong blangs nas 'tshogs pa sgrub par mi byed pa de ni 'dir gso sbyong byed pa la yan lag tu rnam par gzhag pa de bas na tshogs pa sgrub par mi byed pa de ni 'dir
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis sngar dge 'dun las 'dun pa'i gso sbyong blangs nas 'tshogs pa sgrub par mi byed pa de ni 'dir gso sbyong byed pa la yan lag tu rnam par gzhag pa de bas na tshogs pa sgrub par mi byed pa de ni 'dir
translated: When the bhikṣuṇī saṃgha first takes the poṣadha of the saṃgha from the saṃgha and does not establish the assembly, that is established here as a branch of the poṣadha. Therefore, that which does not establish the assembly

original: dge slong dag med par gso sbyong byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag med par gso sbyong byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known here as the poṣadha performed without bhikṣus.

original: 'di na 'dir lci ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i chos las 'das pa'i kha na ma tho ba pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na 'dir lci ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i chos las 'das pa'i kha na ma tho ba pa'o //
translated: Here, the offense of wrong conduct is related to the heavy dharmas, and it is an offense that is not to be committed.

original: 'dir gleng gzhi las dge slong ma khyod kyis dge slong dag med par gso sbyong dag byas pa bden nam zhes gsungs pa dang yang dge slong ma gang dge slong med par gso sbyong byed na ltung byed do zhes mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gleng gzhi las dge slong ma khyod kyis dge slong dag med par gso sbyong dag byas pa bden nam zhes gsungs pa dang yang dge slong ma gang dge slong med par gso sbyong byed na ltung byed do zhes mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, in the nidana, it is said, “Bhikshuni, is it true that you performed the posadha without bhikshus?” And in the sutra, it is said, “If a bhikshuni performs the posadha without bhikshus, it is a duṣkṛta offense.”

original: dge slong ma'i tshig 'di ni rigs kyi dgongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshig 'di ni rigs kyi dgongs pa can yin no //
translated: The words of the bhikshuni are of the intention of the lineage.

original: gsum pa ni gang la dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas len pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang la dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas len pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The third is said to be accepting the rains retreat in a place where there are no bhikshus.

original: dge slong med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A place where there are no bhikshus means

original: gang la las rnams thams cad mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la las rnams thams cad mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: where no activities are performed.

original: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni gang na las gcig kyang mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni gang na las gcig kyang mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Its analysis is that it means where even one activity is not known.

original: gnas gang na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bzhi yan chad gnas shin glas byed pa med pa de ni de las 'dis byas so//
analyzed: gnas gang na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bzhi yan chad gnas shin glas byed pa med pa de ni de las 'dis byas so//
translated: Where is it? In any place where four or more fully ordained monks who are naturally abiding there, without being invited, are staying.

original: 'di'i don ni gso sbyong dang / gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa dag las ma nyams pa dang / lci ba'i chos rnams bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gso sbyong dang / gdams dag dang rjes su bstan pa dag las ma nyams pa dang / lci ba'i chos rnams bzung ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is not impaired by the poṣadha purification ceremony, instruction, or teaching, and it is the taking up of the heavy duties.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dge slong rnams la 'di tsam nyid la gnyis po 'di bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di yongs su bzung ba'o //🔽gang zhig dbyar gnas par gyur pa la gnas pa mi @46a * //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dge slong rnams la 'di tsam nyid la gnyis po 'di bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di yongs su bzung ba'o // gang zhig dbyar gnas par gyur pa la gnas pa mi @46a * //
translated: For fully ordained monks who are like that, this much is called the accomplishment of the two, and this is taken up.🔽For one who has entered the rainy season retreat, it is not proper to stay where it is not proper to stay, and it is not proper to stay without relying on a group of women.

original: rigs pa dang / bud med kyi tshogs la brten pa med pas 'dug pa mi rigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir lci ba'i chos bzung ba la kun nas brten pa 'di ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang / bud med kyi tshogs la brten pa med pas 'dug pa mi rigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir lci ba'i chos bzung ba la kun nas brten pa 'di ni gnas yin no //
translated: Here, the taking up of the heavy duties is the basis for this.

original: bzhi pa ni gang la dbyar gnas pas gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la gnas gsum gyis dgag dbye mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gang la dbyar gnas pas gnyis ka'i dge 'dun la gnas gsum gyis dgag dbye mi byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The fourth is for one who has entered the rainy season retreat, where the two saṃghas do not perform the lifting of restrictions with the three bases.

original: dgag dbye'i nyin mo las 'das pa las kha na ma tho ba ni gso sbyong dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i nyin mo las 'das pa las kha na ma tho ba ni gso sbyong dang 'dra'o //
translated: The offense of transgressing the date of the lifting of restrictions is similar to the confession and restoration of the individual.

original: lci ba'i chos las 'das pa las gyur ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: lci ba'i chos las 'das pa las gyur ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The offense of transgressing the heavy rules is a downfall.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i ltung byed gsum ste /
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i ltung byed gsum ste /
translated: From here on are the three downfalls of harming others.

original: de rnams kyi dang po ni gang zhen dbul po sra brkyang sbyor du bcug pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dang po ni gang zhen dbul po sra brkyang sbyor du bcug pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first of these is stated in the verse: “To make the poor do the summer retreat.”

original: gal te 'dir sbyin pa dang sbyor du 'jug pa dang / bsod nams lhag par sbyong pa'i sgo nas gnyis ka'i don du sra brkyang sbyor du 'jug na byas sam byed du 'jug na thab na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dir sbyin pa dang sbyor du 'jug pa dang / bsod nams lhag par sbyong pa'i sgo nas gnyis ka'i don du sra brkyang sbyor du 'jug na byas sam byed du 'jug na thab na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one makes the poor do the summer retreat through the door of giving, of making them work, or of increasing their merit, and if one does it or has it done for the sake of both oneself and others, then it is a downfall if one does it or has it done.

original: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one does it in advance, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan la yang chos gos gtan pa'i zong tsam dge 'dun gyi don du dbul po sbyor du bcug na yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la yang chos gos gtan pa'i zong tsam dge 'dun gyi don du dbul po sbyor du bcug na yang ltung byed do //
translated: If one makes the poor do the summer retreat for the sake of the Saṅgha, even if it is only for the sake of the material for the robes, it is a downfall.

original: chos gos gtan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe tsam du rnam par gnas par gyur par rig par bya ste ma chog pa la ni nyes pas so //
analyzed: chos gos gtan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir dpe tsam du rnam par gnas par gyur par rig par bya ste ma chog pa la ni nyes pas so //
translated: The term “fixed robe” should be understood as a mere example here, because there is a fault in not having enough.

original: du ma sbyor du bcug pa la ni re re las kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma sbyor du bcug pa la ni re re las kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes many people do it, then there is an offense for each person.

original: gnyis pa ni gang la chos gos gtan pa dbyung ba'i phyir bag yangs su bya ba'i tshogs pa la mi sbyin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang la chos gos gtan pa dbyung ba'i phyir bag yangs su bya ba'i tshogs pa la mi sbyin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second is stated as “not giving to the assembly for the purpose of taking out the fixed robe.”

original: dus su dbyung ba'i phyir tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la ni spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bag yangs su bya ba zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus su dbyung ba'i phyir tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la ni spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bag yangs su bya ba zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught as “taking a break” because it is established as a downfall of abandoning the training for not giving to the assembly for the purpose of taking it out in a timely manner.

original: dpyid zla ra ba'i nya tshun chad glo bur du sra brkyang 'byin par rjes su gnang ba'i dus der ram gzhan la dgos pa'i dbang 'ga' zhig gis sra brkyang dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpyid zla ra ba'i nya tshun chad glo bur du sra brkyang 'byin par rjes su gnang ba'i dus der ram gzhan la dgos pa'i dbang 'ga' zhig gis sra brkyang dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: The time when it is permitted to take out the rainy season robe early is from the first day of the first autumn month.

original: bag yangs su bya ba gang yin pa de la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag yangs su bya ba gang yin pa de la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: in regard to that which is to be done with ease.

original: de lta bas na dus tha dad pa tsam gyis 'di ni spang ba'i ltung byed las tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dus tha dad pa tsam gyis 'di ni spang ba'i ltung byed las tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is distinct from the offense of wrongdoing due to the mere difference in time.

original: 'dir spang ba nyid la rnyed pa ma byas pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bas na 'di rnam par ma bzhag go //🔽dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs pa nyid la chos gos gtan pa dbyung ba'i phyir de thob pa'i zhu ba nyid zhu ba mi byed par mtshams las 'da' bar byed pa la @46b tshogs pa mi sbyin pa'i sems kyis 'di dang 'og ma la kha na ma tho
analyzed: 'dir spang ba nyid la rnyed pa ma byas pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de bas na 'di rnam par ma bzhag go // dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs pa nyid la chos gos gtan pa dbyung ba'i phyir de thob pa'i zhu ba nyid zhu ba mi byed par mtshams las 'da' bar byed pa la @46b tshogs pa mi sbyin pa'i sems kyis 'di dang 'og ma la kha na ma tho
translated: Here, the reason for not acquiring is the very relinquishment, therefore, this is not established.🔽For the purpose of removing the robe, he does not request the very request for the purpose of obtaining it from the very assembly of the community of nuns, and he transgresses the boundary.

original: bar rnam bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bar rnam bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: In this and the following, the mind of not giving to the assembly is the basis.

original: gang la gsum pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gsum pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: The third should be stated.

original: de'i phyir gos 'gyed pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gos 'gyed pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: also for the distribution of robes.

original: tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is stated because it is related to “not giving to the assembly.”

original: rang gi rnyed pa gzhan la bgo ba'i phyir rgyu mtshan 'di yin pa de bas na 'dir yang ba nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rnyed pa gzhan la bgo ba'i phyir rgyu mtshan 'di yin pa de bas na 'dir yang ba nyid med pa'o //
translated: Since one’s own gain is shared with others, there is no stinginess here.

original: 'dir gos smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gos smos pa ni /
translated: The mention of “robes” here

original: dpe tsam du zad ded ltar yang /
analyzed: dpe tsam du zad ded ltar yang /
translated: is merely an example.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa gzhan la bgo ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnyed pa gzhan la bgo ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that this fault is eliminated by sharing with others the gain that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'dis len mi 'dod pa nyid ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dis len mi 'dod pa nyid ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, “not wanting to take” means “not doing.”

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la'o //
translated: “Here” means “not giving to the assembly.”

original: len mi 'dod pa nyid ces bya ba ni shugs kyis skal ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: len mi 'dod pa nyid ces bya ba ni shugs kyis skal ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: “Not wanting to take” should be understood by implication as “not sharing.”

original: len mi 'dod pa nyid la /
analyzed: len mi 'dod pa nyid la /
translated: “Not wanting to take”

original: tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs pa mi sbyin pa la byas pa nyid do //
translated: means “not giving to the assembly.”

original: de bas na len mi 'dod pa la 'dir ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na len mi 'dod pa la 'dir ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that there is no offense for one who does not wish to accept.

original: gzhan la gnod par spyod pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed gsum mo /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par spyod pa las gyur pa'i ltung byed gsum mo /
translated: There are three downfalls that occur through harming others.

original: // / gang la dbyar khang yal bar 'dor ba las gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la dbyar khang yal bar 'dor ba las gyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall that occurs through neglecting the rainy season retreat?

original: de'i phyir dbyar khang ma gtad par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dge 'dun gyi'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyar khang ma gtad par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te / dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: Therefore, it says, “through going without turning over the rainy season retreat.”🔽It is either of the Saṅgha or of an individual.

original: gang zag gi yang zhes bya ba bye brag ma smos pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi yang zhes bya ba bye brag ma smos pa'o //
translated: It is not specified.

original: shin tu stobs dang ldan pa la dge 'dun gyi las log par rtogs pa la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa'i byir ro //
analyzed: shin tu stobs dang ldan pa la dge 'dun gyi las log par rtogs pa la nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa'i byir ro //
translated: If it is very powerful, it is established as a fault in the Saṅgha’s activities.

original: gnas mal gyi rnam pa la dbyar khang 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi rnam pa la dbyar khang 'di yin te /
translated: The form of bedding is the rainy season retreat.

original: de bas na 'di la gnas mal bzhin du blta bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la gnas mal bzhin du blta bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it should be viewed as bedding.

original: de 'dir ma gtad pa de la bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de 'dir ma gtad pa de la bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is not turned over to him.

original: gal te gnas de la nye gnas pa nyid yod na bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te gnas de la nye gnas pa nyid yod na bya ba nyid do //
translated: If there is a nearby place, it is turned over.

original: gal te med na khyim pa 'di la zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te med na khyim pa 'di la zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: If not, it is to be determined as “this layman’s.”

original: brtsams pa'i cha gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: brtsams pa'i cha gang la yin zhe na /
translated: What part of the undertaking is it?

original: de'i phyir nye 'khor btang na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye 'khor btang na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “if the vicinity is abandoned.”

original: dbyar khang gi 'phral gyi bya ba rnams kyi yang dag par srid par gyur pa'i phyogs ni 'dir nye khor du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar khang gi 'phral gyi bya ba rnams kyi yang dag par srid par gyur pa'i phyogs ni 'dir nye khor du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The vicinity is the place where the summer retreat house is built, and where the immediate duties of the summer retreat are performed.

original: dbyar khang slar mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: dbyar khang slar mi gtong ngo //
translated: The summer retreat house is not to be returned.

original: khang khyim gyi gzhi dang tshong khang gi gzhi yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khang khyim gyi gzhi dang tshong khang gi gzhi yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The foundation of the house and the foundation of the shop are also like that.

original: slar mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos @47a * //
analyzed: slar mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos @47a * //
translated: The word “also” is used because it is a continuation of “not to be returned.”

original: so ; /'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: so ; /'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
translated: Here, the text of those two sūtras is in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: de lta bas na dge slong mas dbyar khang slar mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas dbyar khang slar mi gtong ngo //
translated: Therefore, the nun’s summer retreat house is not to be returned.

original: gtong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is returned, she commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: dbyar khang yal bar 'dor ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dbyar khang yal bar 'dor ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall to abandon the rainy season retreat.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed bzhi ston te /
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed bzhi ston te /
translated: From here on are the four downfalls related to going and not going.

original: de rnams kyi dang po ni gang la dbyar gyi nang du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dang po ni gang la dbyar gyi nang du ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first of these is stated in the verse: “To go wandering in the countryside during the rainy season.”

original: bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir khas mi len pa nyid la yang zhes bya bas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir khas mi len pa nyid la yang zhes bya bas rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since it does not specify, “not accepting” is understood by the word “even.”

original: bya bas 'gro ba ni ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: bya bas 'gro ba ni ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: Going by activity is not going wandering in the countryside.

original: de bas na byin gyis brlabs te 'gro ba la 'dis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byin gyis brlabs te 'gro ba la 'dis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this does not apply to going after consecrating the retreat.

original: bud med kyi tshogs la ni shin tu 'phyan pa nyid 'di yin te dus gang gi tshe skyes pas kyang 'phyan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bud med kyi tshogs la ni shin tu 'phyan pa nyid 'di yin te dus gang gi tshe skyes pas kyang 'phyan par mi bya ste /
translated: This is the extreme wandering among groups of women, and even men should not wander there.

original: der yang 'gro ba de bas na kha na ma tho ba 'di'o //
analyzed: der yang 'gro ba de bas na kha na ma tho ba 'di'o //
translated: Since one goes there, this is a downfall.

original: lam du zhugs pa'i tshe ni ltung byed 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lam du zhugs pa'i tshe ni ltung byed 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This downfall is to be understood when one is on the road.

original: bar chad nye bar gnas pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bar chad brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba byung na dbyar gyi nang logs su 'gro ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad nye bar gnas pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bar chad brgyad po dag las gang yang rung ba byung na dbyar gyi nang logs su 'gro ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not go to the place where one is to spend the rainy season, because of the second reason.

original: gnyis pa ni gang la dbyar gnas pa'i 'og tu der mi 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gang la dbyar gnas pa'i 'og tu der mi 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: The second reason is that one does not go to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.

original: der zhes bya ba ni ljongs rgyu zhing mi 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni ljongs rgyu zhing mi 'gro ba la'o //
translated: The phrase “to that place” means that one does not go to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.🔽The phrase “one does not go beyond the path” means that one does not go beyond the path to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.

original: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu lam mi 'da' bar byed pa la kha na ma thob ba 'di skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye byas pa'i 'og tu lam mi 'da' bar byed pa la kha na ma thob ba 'di skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.

original: phyogs kun nas 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mi 'gro ba la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i 'og ma dag gi tshogs rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kun nas 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mi 'gro ba la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i 'og ma dag gi tshogs rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.🔽The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.🔽The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.🔽The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.🔽The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means that there is no offense for not going to the place where one is to spend the rainy season.

original: nus pa gang dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba la dogs pa dang 'gal ba gnyis mi srid pas de lta bu'i lam grogs dang 'phrad pa la mi 'gro na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa gang dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba la dogs pa dang 'gal ba gnyis mi srid pas de lta bu'i lam grogs dang 'phrad pa la mi 'gro na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “one does not go because of the danger” means that one does not go because of the danger of being attacked by bandits.🔽The phrase “there is no offense” means

original: tshes bcu drug gi 'og rol du lam grogs la sdod pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: tshes bcu drug gi 'og rol du lam grogs la sdod pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the companion stays behind on the sixteenth day of the lunar month.

original: gsum pa ni gang la yul 'khor dogs pa dang bcas par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang la yul 'khor dogs pa dang bcas par 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The third is stated: “When going to a country where there is danger.”

original: ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: The phrase “wandering in the country” is supplied.

original: dogs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni chom rkun pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: dogs pa dang bcas pa nyid ni chom rkun pa'i 'jigs pas 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Danger means being afraid of the danger of robbers.

original: bzhi pa gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: The fourth should be stated.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa dang bcas par yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa dang bcas par yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Also when there is hostility.”

original: yul 'khor du 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba'i phyir rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: yul 'khor du 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba'i phyir rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is used because of the connection with “when going to a country.”

original: yul 'khor gang @47b na dgra bo mi mthun pa yod pa de ni mi mthun pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: yul 'khor gang @47b na dgra bo mi mthun pa yod pa de ni mi mthun pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: A country where there is an enemy is one with hostility.

original: phyogs 'dir su yang 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba dgag pa'i khrims su byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs 'dir su yang 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba dgag pa'i khrims su byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
translated: This is the reason for the rule prohibiting going to such places, as in the statement, “No one should go there.”

original: skyes pa nyid la sogs pa'i dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa nyid la sogs pa'i dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a reason for suspecting that one has committed a root downfall.

original: gang du 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa dang bcas pa gnyis po de la kha na mtho ba gnyis po 'dir dag kyang bskyed pa'o //🔽'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas thob pa ni /
analyzed: gang du 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa dang bcas pa gnyis po de la kha na mtho ba gnyis po 'dir dag kyang bskyed pa'o // 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas thob pa ni /
translated: In the case of both the fearsome and the unappealing, these two downfalls are generated.

original: dogs pa dang bcas pa'i ltung byed bskyed pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa dang bcas pa'i ltung byed bskyed pa'i dus yin no //
translated: The time for generating the downfall of suspicion is when one has attained a fearsome place.

original: mi mthun pa dang bcas pa'i ltung byed la mi mthun pa dang bcas pa nye ba'i gnas thob pa bskyed pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang bcas pa'i ltung byed la mi mthun pa dang bcas pa nye ba'i gnas thob pa bskyed pa'i dus so //
translated: The time for generating the downfall of the unappealing is when one has attained a place that is unappealing.

original: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed ba zhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed ba zhi pa'o /
translated: The downfalls that result from going or not going are pacified.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni smra ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed gnyis ston te /
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni smra ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed gnyis ston te /
translated: From here on, the two downfalls that result from speech are presented.

original: de gnyis kyi dang po ni gang la lha'i gnas la sogs pa dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas su song ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dang po ni gang la lha'i gnas la sogs pa dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas su song ste /
translated: The first of these two is when one goes to the abode of the gods and so forth, or to the abode of the tīrthikas,

original: rtsod par byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtsod par byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and engages in debate.

original: gang gi don gcig rtogs pa'i dus na ltung byed 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi don gcig rtogs pa'i dus na ltung byed 'byung ba'o //
translated: The offense is incurred when one understands the meaning of a single statement.

original: smra ba gzhan la rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyis de la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba gzhan la rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyis de la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One engages in debate by means of a single statement with another speaker.

original: 'dra ba gzhan la rnam par nges par rtogs pa la rtsod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan la rnam par nges par rtogs pa la rtsod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not debate with another who is uncertain.

original: de ltar rnam par 'byed pa las ;
analyzed: de ltar rnam par 'byed pa las ;
translated: Thus, the Vinaya Discourses states:

original: rtsod pa ni 'thab krol zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni 'thab krol zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Debate is quarreling.”

original: gnyis pa bstan pa ni de'i phyir skabs ma phye bar dri ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa ni de'i phyir skabs ma phye bar dri ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second is stated: “Therefore, it is when one asks a question without having been given permission.”

original: gang gi tshig gi skabs ma phye bar dri ba de dris pa la ltung byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshig gi skabs ma phye bar dri ba de dris pa la ltung byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The offense is incurred when one asks a question without having been given permission to do so.

original: 'dir gleng gzhi las dge slong la gsungs mod kyis ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gleng gzhi las dge slong la gsungs mod kyis ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa las /
translated: Here, although the Buddha spoke to the monks in the nidāna, in the presentation of the offenses,

original: spyir bstan gyi bye brag 'di bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyir bstan gyi bye brag 'di bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a specific teaching within the general teaching.

original: khyim pa dang mu stegs pa dag la shin tu nyes pa stobs dang ldan pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'di spyir thams cad khyad par med par 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang mu stegs pa dag la shin tu nyes pa stobs dang ldan pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'di spyir thams cad khyad par med par 'phangs pa'o //
translated: This is a general criticism, without distinction, of householders and tīrthikas, who are said to be “powerful in their faults.”

original: stan pa ting ste phan tshun kun dga' bar byas nas lung 'dri ba'i sbyor bas skabs 'byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la lung 'dri ba'i sbyor ba yod pas na lung 'dri ba'i sbyor ba dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: stan pa ting ste phan tshun kun dga' bar byas nas lung 'dri ba'i sbyor bas skabs 'byed du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la lung 'dri ba'i sbyor ba yod pas na lung 'dri ba'i sbyor ba dri bar bya'o //
translated: “One should make an occasion by teaching the Dharma and by being mutually agreeable, through the application of questioning the scriptures” means that because there is the application of questioning the scriptures in this case, one should make an occasion by questioning the scriptures.

original: 'dir gzhung ni chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba'i lung ci dag bklags zhal ston cing mkhyen zhes dri bas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽smra ba las gyur pa'i @48a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba'i lung ci dag bklags zhal ston cing mkhyen zhes dri bas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // smra ba las gyur pa'i @48a * //
translated: Here, the text says, “One should ask, ‘What scriptures of Abhidharma and Vinaya have you read and explained? What do you know?’”

original: ltung byed gnyis so /
analyzed: ltung byed gnyis so /
translated: Two downfalls due to speech.

original: // / da 'di man chad ni bshang ba dang 'brel pa'i ltung byed gsum ston te /
analyzed: // / da 'di man chad ni bshang ba dang 'brel pa'i ltung byed gsum ston te /
translated: From here on, the three downfalls related to excrement are presented.

original: phyi sar gcig pu 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'dir gcig ba'i sa ni phyis sa'o //
analyzed: phyi sar gcig pu 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te / 'dir gcig ba'i sa ni phyis sa'o //
translated: The monk who has committed the offense of emission of semen is to be expelled from the monastery, and so on.🔽Here, the term outside means outside the monastery.

original: dbyar khang gi nye 'khor 'dom gang las logs shig pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: dbyar khang gi nye 'khor 'dom gang las logs shig pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
translated: Outside the monastery means outside the area of the monastery, which is one krośa in extent.

original: 'dir dbyar khang gi nye 'khor las 'da' ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus te /
analyzed: 'dir dbyar khang gi nye 'khor las 'da' ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus te /
translated: Here, the term outside the monastery means outside the area of the monastery.

original: bud med du gyur pa la grogs nyid do //🔽nus pa gang yang rung ba len du bcug pa dge slong ma'am rab tu byung ba kho na la'o //
analyzed: bud med du gyur pa la grogs nyid do // nus pa gang yang rung ba len du bcug pa dge slong ma'am rab tu byung ba kho na la'o //
translated: The term woman means a female human.🔽The term capable means that she is able to receive the semen.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa ni de'i phyir rtsva sngon po'i steng du bshang ba dor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa ni de'i phyir rtsva sngon po'i steng du bshang ba dor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second rule is stated: With regard to defecating on green grass.

original: mi 'dor ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mi 'dor ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not defecate there.

original: 'dir mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni bshang ba med pa zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni bshang ba med pa zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the term does not defecate should be understood to mean does not defecate feces.

original: sngon po la mi gtsang bas phog pa ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus so //
analyzed: sngon po la mi gtsang bas phog pa ni 'dir dngos gzhi'i dus so //
translated: The term green means that the grass is struck by impurity.

original: nad pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nad pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is sick.

original: rtsva sngon po thams cad la khyab pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsva sngon po thams cad la khyab pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also in all green grass.

original: ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word also is stated because of following the statement “there is no offense.”

original: gang la gsum pa de brjod par bya ste de'i phyir rtsig pa'i phag tu ma bltas par bshad ba dor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang la gsum pa de brjod par bya ste de'i phyir rtsig pa'i phag tu ma bltas par bshad ba dor ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The third should be stated, therefore it is said: “with regard to discarding feces without looking in a wall.”

original: nyes byas su 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur pa'o //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rtsig pa pu shu btags pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsig pa pu shu btags pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if it is a wall with a hole.

original: ra ba'i phyi rol du mi slob par gyur na /
analyzed: ra ba'i phyi rol du mi slob par gyur na /
translated: If one does not train outside the wall,

original: de'i tshe phag tu ma bltas par bshang ba dor ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe phag tu ma bltas par bshang ba dor ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: at that time there is no offense in discarding feces without looking.

original: de gnas pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnas pa la 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not enter that state.

original: blta bar nus pa nyid la 'dir bsgrub pa rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: blta bar nus pa nyid la 'dir bsgrub pa rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to establish here the ability to look.

original: gal te bsgrub par mi nus pa nyid yin na nyes pa mi rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par mi nus pa nyid yin na nyes pa mi rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is not possible to establish that, then the offense is not reasonable.

original: mi gtsang ba la bong rdog 'phangs bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la bong rdog 'phangs bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not throw clods of earth at filth.

original: zhes bya ba la gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las cho dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po lhan ljin gyi drung du 'gro ba de sbom dga' mos mthong nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las cho dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po lhan ljin gyi drung du 'gro ba de sbom dga' mos mthong nas /
translated: The text is as follows: In the Ksudraka Collection, the elder Mahākāśyapa was going to a charnel ground. Thullanandā saw him.

original: de myur ba myur bar song nas /
analyzed: de myur ba myur bar song nas /
translated: She quickly went🔽and struck the charnel ground with her foot, saying, “Get up!”

original: ljan ljin de'i steng du bong car ces zer ba bsnun pas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po'i chos gos dang lhung bzed snod mi gtsang ba'i zeg mas ma rungs par gyur pa nas /
analyzed: ljan ljin de'i steng du bong car ces zer ba bsnun pas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srungs chen po'i chos gos dang lhung bzed snod mi gtsang ba'i zeg mas ma rungs par gyur pa nas /
translated: The elder Mahākāśyapa’s Dharma robes and alms bowl were defiled by the filth of the charnel ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das gyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na dge slong mas dge slong la mi gtsang bas ma rungs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong mas dge slong la mi gtsang bas ma rungs par mi bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, a nun should not defile a monk with filth.

original: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If she does, she becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: bshang ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed dag sum mo //
analyzed: bshang ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed dag sum mo //
translated: The offenses that arise from excrement are the third.

original: ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu gyur pa rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu gyur pa rnams rdzogs so /
translated: The offenses that are only offenses are complete.

original: // / @48b gang la 'o ma slong ba'i so sor bshags par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / @48b gang la 'o ma slong ba'i so sor bshags par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the individual confession for begging milk?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi khyim nas bdag gi don du 'o ma blangs te 'thung ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi khyim nas bdag gi don du 'o ma blangs te 'thung ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “having taken milk for one’s own sake from the house of another, one should not drink it.”

original: cig nas skabs gang la 'thung ba la zhe na /
analyzed: cig nas skabs gang la 'thung ba la zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “At what time should one not drink it?”

original: de'i phyir mi nabs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi nabs so zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gnas skabs gang dang ldan pas blangs pa'i gnas skabs de dang ldan pas zhes bye brag ma smos pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang dang ldan pas blangs pa'i gnas skabs de dang ldan pas zhes bye brag ma smos pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since he does not specify the time, one should understand that one should not drink it at the time when one took it.

original: des bslangs pa'i tshe nyes byas so zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bslangs pa'i tshe nyes byas so zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one drinks it at the time when one took it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽In this context, “it” refers to the milk that one took when one was not sick.

original: mi na ba des blangs shing za ba la ltung byed ces bya ba 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi na ba des blangs shing za ba la ltung byed ces bya ba 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the downfall that is accrued by drinking it.

original: gang la so sor bshags par bya ba gzhan dgu po dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la so sor bshags par bya ba gzhan dgu po dag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What are the other nine downfalls that are to be individually confessed?”

original: de'i phyir zho dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi lbu ba dang / nya sha dang sha skas rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zho dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi lbu ba dang / nya sha dang sha skas rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “curds, butter, oil, honey, molasses, fish, and meat.”

original: gzhan gyi khyim nas bdag gi don du blangs te 'thungs zos pa la'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim nas bdag gi don du blangs te 'thungs zos pa la'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is stated because one drinks and eats after taking it from another’s house for one’s own purpose.

original: de dag la gzhan bslangs pa las gzhan thob pa la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag la gzhan bslangs pa las gzhan thob pa la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault in obtaining something else than that which was requested.

original: 'dir 'o ma la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag las gang yang rung ba gzhan pa bslang pa las gang yang rung ba gzhan thob cing zos pa la ni nyes pa na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir 'o ma la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag las gang yang rung ba gzhan pa bslang pa las gang yang rung ba gzhan thob cing zos pa la ni nyes pa na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating something else than that which was previously taught, such as milk, etc., if one obtains something else than that which was requested.

original: mi bsod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bslangs te thob pa la na smad pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mi bsod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bslangs te thob pa la na smad pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: There is also no fault in obtaining something else than that which was requested.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa bsod pa slong ba la mi bsod pa thob pa la yang na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa bsod pa slong ba la mi bsod pa thob pa la yang na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault in obtaining something else than that which was requested, such as milk, etc., if one requests something else than that which was previously taught, such as milk, etc.

original: der rtogs pa la de thob pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: der rtogs pa la de thob pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word also is stated because it is to be understood that there is no fault in obtaining that which is good by asking for it.

original: mi bsod par bsod pa de bslangs pa las 'o ma la sogs pa bsod pa de thob cing zos sam 'thungs pa la yang nyes pa na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: mi bsod par bsod pa de bslangs pa las 'o ma la sogs pa bsod pa de thob cing zos sam 'thungs pa la yang nyes pa na smad pa med do zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: There is no fault in eating or drinking that which is good, such as milk, that is obtained by asking for it, even though it is not good to ask for it.

original: 'dir thams cad du 'dir ba za' ba nye bar mtshon pa'i rnyed pa'i zhes smos par rig pa bya'o /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du 'dir ba za' ba nye bar mtshon pa'i rnyed pa'i zhes smos par rig pa bya'o /
translated: Here, the word obtaining should be understood to illustrate all cases of eating here.

analyzed: bsod pa rgyu mtshan gyi thob pa dang bslangs pa la bsod pa slong ba'i rgyu mtshan la mi bsod pa rnyed pa la na smad par brjod do ;

original: / de la 'dir cing gis gzhan la bslangs pas thob pa la gzhan bslangs pa'i rgyus thob pa la khan ma thob yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de la 'dir cing gis gzhan la bslangs pas thob pa la gzhan bslangs pa'i rgyus thob pa la khan ma thob yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the word even indicates that there is no fault in obtaining by asking another and in obtaining by the cause of asking another.🔽The word even indicates that there is no fault in obtaining by asking another and in obtaining by the cause of asking another.🔽Here, the word even indicates that there is no fault in obtaining by asking another and in obtaining by the cause of asking another.
