original: mkhan po'i phyogs 'di ni bdag gi mkhan po'i zhes bya bas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: mkhan po'i phyogs 'di ni bdag gi mkhan po'i zhes bya bas blangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: The side of the preceptor is the side of one's preceptor, etc.

original: gal te gang zag gzhan yin na de'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'di la ma gus pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te gang zag gzhan yin na de'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'di la ma gus pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: If it is another person, then it is the side of one who is not respectful to that side.

original: mi sbyong ba'i gzhi ni sbyong bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi sbyong ba'i gzhi ni sbyong bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: The basis of not purifying is not purifying.

original: bdag nyid dag par bya ba'i phyir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye dag mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dag par bya ba'i phyir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye dag mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is not purifying the poṣadha and pravāraṇa in order to purify oneself.

original: mi gnas par 'dug pa la sogs pas sbyong bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas par 'dug pa la sogs pas sbyong bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is not purifying by remaining in a non-dwelling place, etc.

original: gzhan du na 'jug pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'jug pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, one would not accomplish entering. These are the actions.

original: de lta bas na 'di rnams la sngom pa thams cad 'jig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di rnams la sngom pa thams cad 'jig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, these should be known as the side of destroying all vows,

original: gso sbyong byed pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gso sbyong byed pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for one who is purifying.

original: 'di'i tshig med pa'i phyir rjes su bsgrub par bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i tshig med pa'i phyir rjes su bsgrub par bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Because it lacks the words of this, it should be understood as something to be accomplished later.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du na 'jug pa bsgrub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las thob pa'i phyir dang dgag dbye bsgrub pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan du na 'jug pa bsgrub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las thob pa'i phyir dang dgag dbye bsgrub pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is understood that the purification is performed by following the accomplishment of the purification, because it is obtained from the reasoning that otherwise the entry would not be accomplished.

original: mtshan mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gso sbyong byed pa 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gso sbyong byed pa 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This purification is performed for the full ordination with the same characteristics.

original: sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: che ge mo zhig dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig dgongs su gsol /
translated: So-and-so, please consider this.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the Saṅgha's purification.

original: bdag dge tshul ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags na /🔽bdag dge tshul ming 'di zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: bdag dge tshul ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags na / bdag dge tshul ming 'di zhes bgyi ba /
translated: For me, the novice named so-and-so, it is also the fifteenth day of purification.🔽I, the novice named so-and-so, am pure with regard to the obstructing factors.

original: bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag nyid che zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag nyid che zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I declare my purity and so on.

original: bslab pa byin pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la sbyor ba dge slong dang @52a * //🔽'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la sbyor ba dge slong dang @52a * // 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The giving of training is similar to that of a fully ordained monk.

original: 'dir 'di la dge slong ma yang de bzhin du phan tshun 'dra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di la dge slong ma yang de bzhin du phan tshun 'dra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, a fully ordained nun is also to be understood as similar to that.

original: dge slong bzhin du 'dis lhag par spyod pa la /
analyzed: dge slong bzhin du 'dis lhag par spyod pa la /
translated: Like a fully ordained monk, she engages in the same training.

original: dge slong bzhin du yang gzhan la brdeg pa dang / gzas pa dang / 'gyod pa bskyed pa la sogs pas ltung ba rnams bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong bzhin du yang gzhan la brdeg pa dang / gzas pa dang / 'gyod pa bskyed pa la sogs pas ltung ba rnams bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Like a fully ordained monk, she generates downfalls through striking others, threatening others, causing regret, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who is not fully ordained also possesses it.

original: 'di la rnam pa 'dis dge slong dang mnyam pa nyid yod par gyur kyang gang la byin len byed pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed la sogs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la bskyed pa de la de las ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa 'dis dge slong dang mnyam pa nyid yod par gyur kyang gang la byin len byed pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed la sogs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la bskyed pa de la de las ma yin te /
translated: Even though in this case, by this aspect, there is equality with a fully ordained monk, that which is generated in one who is not fully ordained, such as the downfall of sleeping together with one who has taken the novitiate vows, is not that.

original: gang la yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan las skyes pa rang gi bdag nyid la yang skyes pa nyid nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa gzhan las skyes pa rang gi bdag nyid la yang skyes pa nyid nye bar gnas pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The full ordination that arises from another is also present in oneself, and the full ordination that arises from the one who holds it is also present in oneself.

original: de la 'dir nyams pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir nyams pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is similar to a degeneration.

original: de la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa byin pa de la bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa byin pa de la bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so in the case of the one who has received the training, because he does not possess the full ordination.

original: phyogs gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is only partial.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text of the question:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong la rgyu dus gsog 'jog bgyis par 'gyur /🔽gsum gyis te /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong la rgyu dus gsog 'jog bgyis par 'gyur / gsum gyis te /
translated: “Venerable, a monk may accumulate wealth at a time when it is permitted.🔽By how many of the three?

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: Which three?

original: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
translated: Accumulating it himself, having it accumulated by a monk, or having it accumulated by a saṅgha of monks.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong ma la rgyu dus gsog 'jog byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong ma la rgyu dus gsog 'jog byas par 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, a nun may accumulate wealth at a time when it is permitted.

original: gsum gyis te /
analyzed: gsum gyis te /
translated: By how many of the three?

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
translated: The monk himself stores it, a nun stores it, or the community of nuns stores it.

original: btsun pa re zhig bslab pa byin pa la rgyu dus gsog 'jog byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig bslab pa byin pa la rgyu dus gsog 'jog byas par 'gyur /
translated: “Reverend, if a monk gives instruction to a nun, does that constitute storing?”

original: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “There are four:

original: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o //
translated: the monk himself stores it, a monk who gives instruction stores it, a monk stores it, and the community of monks stores it.”

original: btsun pa re zhig bslab pa byin pa mo la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig bslab pa byin pa mo la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Reverend, if a monk gives instruction to a nun, does that constitute storing?”

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “There are four:

original: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pa mos gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog @52b 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pa mos gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog @52b 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the monk himself stores it, a monk who gives instruction stores it, a nun stores it, and the community of nuns stores it.”

original: dge slob ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slob ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word also is connected with the phrase not possessing full ordination.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text of the question:🔽“Reverend, a probationary nun...

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slob ma la zhes bya ba nas lnga ste /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slob ma la zhes bya ba nas lnga ste /
translated: ...five.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slob mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pa mos gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slob mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bslab pa byin pa mos gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyis gsog 'jog byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those that she herself stores, those that a probationary nun stores, those that a novice nun stores, those that a fully ordained nun stores, and those that the community of fully ordained nuns stores.”

original: 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes yod pa la'o zhes bya ba ltung ba la sbyor ba 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa bsten pa na dge slong gi 'du shes yod pa la'o zhes bya ba ltung ba la sbyor ba 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “when she has the perception of a fully ordained monk” is similar to the application in the downfall.

original: dge slong sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gzugs su bsgyur nas bya ba ma yin pa byed pa yin pa de la der ltung ba nyid do //🔽gal te byed pa'i dus na dge slong la sogs pa'i 'du shes ma brjed par gyur na ltung ba 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: dge slong sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gzugs su bsgyur nas bya ba ma yin pa byed pa yin pa de la der ltung ba nyid do // gal te byed pa'i dus na dge slong la sogs pa'i 'du shes ma brjed par gyur na ltung ba 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: A monk, through the power of mantra, medicine, etc., transforms his body into the form of another being, such as an animal, and engages in sexual activity. He incurs a downfall.🔽If, at the time of engaging in the act, he does not forget his identity as a monk, he incurs a downfall similar to the one described above.🔽If he does not remember his identity as a monk, he is censured.

original: med na ni smad pa'o zhes bya ba de'i tshe ltung ba 'byin pa de la bdag nyid dge slong yin pa'i 'du shes med cing brjed par gyur pa nyid yin na ni ltung ba la sbyor ba de'i tshig 'og mar na smad pa yin no //
analyzed: med na ni smad pa'o zhes bya ba de'i tshe ltung ba 'byin pa de la bdag nyid dge slong yin pa'i 'du shes med cing brjed par gyur pa nyid yin na ni ltung ba la sbyor ba de'i tshig 'og mar na smad pa yin no //
translated: If, at the time of engaging in the act, he does not remember his identity as a monk, he is censured.

original: tshig sngar mar sbyor ba byas pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: tshig sngar mar sbyor ba byas pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” in the line “if he engages in the act in the manner described above” is added to indicate that he is censured.

original: khyim pa nyid du sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis gang zhig dge tshul nyid la tshig snga mar sbyor ba byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la de la yang ma rdzogs pa nyid ni na smad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: khyim pa nyid du sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis gang zhig dge tshul nyid la tshig snga mar sbyor ba byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la de la yang ma rdzogs pa nyid ni na smad pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the mere act of applying the term novice monk to one who is a householder, or the mere act of applying the term fully ordained monk to one who is a novice monk, makes him a novice monk or a fully ordained monk.

original: de ma thag pa'i tshig nyid do //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i tshig nyid do //
translated: The word “only” in the verse is to be supplied from the preceding verse.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas brku ba la sbyor zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i phyir rku bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas brku ba la sbyor zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i phyir rku bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the text here states: “If one who is not fully ordained commits theft, he commits an offense because he is not fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa brku ba la ji srid du bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir rkun nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa brku ba la ji srid du bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phyir rkun nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: If one who is not fully ordained commits theft, he commits a serious offense because he is not fully ordained.”

original: 'dir de'i phyir zhes bstan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir de'i phyir zhes bstan par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the word “therefore” should be understood to be stated.

original: tshig snga mar sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang kho na las med na /
analyzed: tshig snga mar sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang kho na las med na /
translated: If it is only the mere act of applying the term novice monk to one who is a householder,

original: de'i tshe sbyor ba na smad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sbyor ba na smad pa'o //
translated: then the act of applying the term is reprehensible.

original: sbyor ba yod na ni de'i tshe byas pa nyid la dngos po la na smad pa mi rigs @53a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba yod na ni de'i tshe byas pa nyid la dngos po la na smad pa mi rigs @53a * //
translated: If it is applied, then it is not logical to deprecate that which is produced.🔽

original: pa'i phyir len pa'i dbang dang rten gyi bye brag gi dbang gis 'di tshig 'og mar gtan du ba'i sbyor ba la ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rig par skyes pa'i bdag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa la ltung byed du rnam par gnas pa la lci
analyzed: pa'i phyir len pa'i dbang dang rten gyi bye brag gi dbang gis 'di tshig 'og mar gtan du ba'i sbyor ba la ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rig par skyes pa'i bdag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas pa la ltung byed du rnam par gnas pa la lci
translated: If there is application, then at that time, it is not reasonable to criticize the one who is engaged, because of the power of the basis and the power of the object, this is established as a downfall in the Vinaya for one who has taken full ordination, in terms of the power of one's own state of mind that has arisen from the cognition of a downfall.

original: ba nyid ni yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la yang rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ba nyid ni yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la yang rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The heaviness is also established in one who has taken full ordination.

original: na smad pa'i sbyor ba de'i tshon med pas de bzhin du 'og ma'i tshig sbyor ba'i dbang gis tshig snga ma la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rig pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: na smad pa'i sbyor ba de'i tshon med pas de bzhin du 'og ma'i tshig sbyor ba'i dbang gis tshig snga ma la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rig pa las skyes pa /
translated: The application of that criticism is not present, so by the power of the application of the words below, in the previous statement, it is explained as arising from the cognition of a downfall that is to come.

original: bdag gi dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba la ltung byed du rnam par gzhag pa la yang ba nyid ni yang dge tshul nyid la sogs pa la rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba la ltung byed du rnam par gzhag pa la yang ba nyid ni yang dge tshul nyid la sogs pa la rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Also, in the case of a downfall that is established as a downfall due to the transformation of one’s status, the status of a novice monk and so on is the basis.

original: 'dir sbyor ba gang yin pa de la mtshan nyid ji lta bar ltung ba dang ltung ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba gang yin pa de la mtshan nyid ji lta bar ltung ba dang ltung ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this case, the application of the terms “downfall” and “non-downfall” should be understood according to the characteristics of the person.🔽The latter is also the basis.

original: phyi ma yang de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi ma yang de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The latter is the basis of the former.🔽In this case, the latter is the status of a novice monk and so on. The former is the status of a fully ordained monk. The application of the terms “downfall” and “non-downfall” should be understood according to the characteristics of the person.

original: 'dir gang du tshig phyi ma ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang du tshig phyi ma ste /
translated: The latter is also the basis of the former.

original: dge tshul nyid la sogs pa la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis bsgrub pa ni de dang ldan pa nyi dang tshig snga ma nyid de la nyes byas yongs su rdzogs par bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: dge tshul nyid la sogs pa la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis bsgrub pa ni de dang ldan pa nyi dang tshig snga ma nyid de la nyes byas yongs su rdzogs par bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The latter is the status of a fully ordained monk. The former is the status of a novice monk and so on. The application of the terms “downfall” and “non-downfall” should be understood according to the characteristics of the person.

original: 'di yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs la sbyor ba byas pa gang yin pa de la mtshan nyid ji lta bar ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs la sbyor ba byas pa gang yin pa de la mtshan nyid ji lta bar ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, whatever is applied to the occasion of full ordination, that should be understood as the definition of a downfall.

original: rdzas bkag pas bzang po la yang de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bkag pa las shin tu khyad par 'phags pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de la yang gang zhig gzhan nyid ni de dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid bkag par gyur pa ni
analyzed: rdzas bkag pas bzang po la yang de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bkag pa las shin tu khyad par 'phags pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de la yang gang zhig gzhan nyid ni de dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid bkag par gyur pa ni
translated: The term “also” indicates that even a good substance that is prohibited is possessed.

original: bstan pa rdzogs pa'i bar gyi mdo 'og ma dag las de gzhan la na smad pa nyid do //🔽du ma ma tshang ba la ni de bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni de las kyang ma tshang bas yan lag tu ma tshang ba la ni na smad pa de bas kyang na smad do //🔽'di lta ste dper na lus kyi reg pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid gnyis la reg par byed pa dang / reg par byed pa'i lus gnyis ka la yan lag yin pas rnam par 'gyur ba gcig pa 'di la de ma thag pa'i tshig go //🔽de ma thag pa de las gzhan zhes bya ba 'di dang snga ma byed pa'o //🔽rnam par 'gyur ba gnyis ka la yang 'dis na smad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa rdzogs pa'i bar gyi mdo 'og ma dag las de gzhan la na smad pa nyid do // du ma ma tshang ba la ni de bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni de las kyang ma tshang bas yan lag tu ma tshang ba la ni na smad pa de bas kyang na smad do // 'di lta ste dper na lus kyi reg pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid gnyis la reg par byed pa dang / reg par byed pa'i lus gnyis ka la yan lag yin pas rnam par 'gyur ba gcig pa 'di la de ma thag pa'i tshig go // de ma thag pa de las gzhan zhes bya ba 'di dang snga ma byed pa'o // rnam par 'gyur ba gnyis ka la yang 'dis na smad par byas pa'o //
translated: The following sutra passage shows that the other offenses are more serious than the first:

original: mi la dud 'gro yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mi'i gnas su dud 'gro zhes smos pa la yang na smad pa de sbyor ro //
analyzed: mi la dud 'gro yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mi'i gnas su dud 'gro zhes smos pa la yang na smad pa de sbyor ro //
translated: “The offense of killing a human is more serious than the offense of killing an animal. The offense of killing a human is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is not a spiritual teacher. The offense of killing a human who is not a spiritual teacher is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner and is a nonreturner. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner and is a nonreturner is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner and is a nonreturner and is an arhat. The offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative and has attained the stages of meditative absorption and is a stream enterer and is a once returner and is a nonreturner and is an arhat is more serious than the offense of killing a human who is a spiritual teacher and a relative

original: dud 'gro dang 'brel pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang 'brel pa la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in relation to an animal.

original: 'di smra ba dang bdag nyid kyi kun du spyod pa bsngags pa la nyes byas su 'gyur gyi /🔽ji ltar mi ma yin pa mthu med pa dang lhan cig tu lus kyi reg pa la sogs pa byed pa la na smad de /🔽sbom por @60a * //
analyzed: 'di smra ba dang bdag nyid kyi kun du spyod pa bsngags pa la nyes byas su 'gyur gyi / ji ltar mi ma yin pa mthu med pa dang lhan cig tu lus kyi reg pa la sogs pa byed pa la na smad de / sbom por @60a * //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct in praising one’s own conduct and speech.

original: 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the case of a powerless nonhuman being, where there is a serious offense in having physical contact with them.🔽It is not like the case of a powerful nonhuman being, where there is a serious offense in having physical contact with them.

original: de bas kyang na smad pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang na smad pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: It is even more reprehensible than that.

original: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi chos can nyid ma yin pa ni reg pa ma yin pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsten pa la de ni reg pa ma yin pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi chos can nyid ma yin pa ni reg pa ma yin pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsten pa la de ni reg pa ma yin pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is not a branch of contact if one is not a person with miraculous powers.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: 'dul byed dag las 'di ni de'i rim pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dir bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul byed dag las 'di ni de'i rim pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dir bsdus pa'o //
translated: “This is the sequence in the Vinaya.”

original: smra ba'i skabs nas rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la smras na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba'i skabs nas rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can mo la smras na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the context of speech, if one speaks to a woman who has miraculous powers, there is a serious offense.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul ba'i chos can mo ma yin pas smra na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul ba'i chos can mo ma yin pas smra na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since she is not one who possesses the quality of magical transformation, if she speaks, it is a pārājika offense for the saṅgha.

original: de la dang po rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can la med pas na smad pa 'di shes so zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can la med pas na smad pa 'di shes so zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the first is understood to be the disparagement of one who does not possess the quality of magical transformation.

original: de bas na gcig la reg pas 'dir reg pa spang ba nyid kyi phyir chos 'di la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba 'di gzhan 'ga' zhig bsten pa dang 'brel pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad du 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gcig la reg pas 'dir reg pa spang ba nyid kyi phyir chos 'di la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba 'di gzhan 'ga' zhig bsten pa dang 'brel pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad du 'du shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the application of this rule is to engage in this Dharma, it is not related to relying on any other.

original: smra ba la sogs pa rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can la ni sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba la sogs pa rnams la rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos can la ni sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who speak and so on, if they possess the quality of magical transformation, it is a serious offense.

original: reg pa la ni dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa la ni dge 'dun lhag ma kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they touch, it is only a saṅghadisesa offense.

original: reg par bya ba nyid ni ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya ba'i lus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: reg par bya ba nyid ni ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya ba'i lus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the quality of being touched is not impaired” is connected to the phrase “the body that is to be relied upon.”

original: 'dir lus kyi reg pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi reg pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro'i rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
translated: Here, the arrangement of tastes is for the sake of experiencing the pleasure of bodily contact.

original: 'dir dper na rma dang nad la sogs pas nyams pas mtshan mi mthun pa'i yan lag gis lus la reg na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir dper na rma dang nad la sogs pas nyams pas mtshan mi mthun pa'i yan lag gis lus la reg na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, if one touches the body with a limb that is impaired by a wound, a disease, etc., it is a grave offense.

original: shu ba dang g-yan pa can dang khyi rngo can gyis reg na yang de bzhin du sbom po'o //
analyzed: shu ba dang g-yan pa can dang khyi rngo can gyis reg na yang de bzhin du sbom po'o //
translated: If one touches one who has leprosy, mild scabies, or mild itch, it is also a grave offense.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus de ltar 'gyur na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus de ltar 'gyur na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one's own body is in that condition, it is a wrong doing.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la 'khyud pa la ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la 'khyud pa la ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one embraces a corpse, it is a grave offense.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rangs pa mo dang / rnam par 'bus gzhig pa mo dang / rnam par bam pa mo dang / rnam par zos pa mo dang / rnam par dmar ba mo dang / rnam par 'thor ba mo nas mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'byung ba de tsam gyi bar du 'dir dam dum du 'thor ba nyid yin pa khas blangs par rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rangs pa mo dang / rnam par 'bus gzhig pa mo dang / rnam par bam pa mo dang / rnam par zos pa mo dang / rnam par dmar ba mo dang / rnam par 'thor ba mo nas mi tshangs par spyod pa'i pham par 'gyur ba 'byung ba de tsam gyi bar du 'dir dam dum du 'thor ba nyid yin pa khas blangs par rigs so //
translated: Similarly, it is proper to accept that the same applies up to the point of the defeat of engaging in sexual intercourse, since the other parts of the body are scattered about in this place.

original: mthu dang ldan pa nyid yan lag nyid yin pa de bas na 'dir ro nyid la ni smad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa nyid yan lag nyid yin pa de bas na 'dir ro nyid la ni smad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the powerful parts are limbs, it is not wrong to say that the mouth is a limb.

original: des na rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa dag la sbom por gsungs so //🔽ga ga tshil byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba @60b ni ;
analyzed: des na rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa dag la sbom por gsungs so // ga ga tshil byed pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba @60b ni ;
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said that the blue-black parts and so on are coarse.🔽Also with regard to the anus.

original: sor mos ga ga tshil byed pa la yang reg par bya ba la yan lag nyid ni ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: sor mos ga ga tshil byed pa la yang reg par bya ba la yan lag nyid ni ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word also is stated because it is a limb that is not impaired, even though one touches the anus with one’s finger.

original: 'di yang 'di lta bu'i yan lag rnams la ga ga tshil byed pa la ni na smad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di lta bu'i yan lag rnams la ga ga tshil byed pa la ni na smad pa nyid do //
translated: Also, in this way, the one who engages in sexual union with such a limb is despised.

original: gnyis ka'i lus ji snyed bstan pa de lta bu nyid la nyams pa la sogs pa rnam par gyur pa la 'dir don nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i lus ji snyed bstan pa de lta bu nyid la nyams pa la sogs pa rnam par gyur pa la 'dir don nyid kyi phyir /
translated: As much as the body of both is shown, so much is the transformation of the degeneration, etc.

original: de lta bu'i reg par bya ba la yongs su ma rdzogs pa grub pa la de lta bu'i reg par bya ba las kyang grub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i reg par bya ba la yongs su ma rdzogs pa grub pa la de lta bu'i reg par bya ba las kyang grub pa'o //
translated: Here, the non-completion of such a tangible object is established, and the establishment of such a tangible object is also established.🔽Bones and hair without nails, teeth, and flesh are different.

original: sen mo dang so dang sha med pa'i rus pa dang spu dag ni gzhan dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang ga ga tshil byed pa gnyis po 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin no ;
analyzed: sen mo dang so dang sha med pa'i rus pa dang spu dag ni gzhan dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang ga ga tshil byed pa gnyis po 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin no ;
translated: This teaching and sexual union are transformations.

original: / sen mo dang so dang sha med pa'i rus pa dang keng rus su gyur pa gzhan dang / spu rnams la yang yan lag gzhan gyis reg pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dag la ni go rims bzhin du sbom po dang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / sen mo dang so dang sha med pa'i rus pa dang keng rus su gyur pa gzhan dang / spu rnams la yang yan lag gzhan gyis reg pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dag la ni go rims bzhin du sbom po dang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: The bones without nails, teeth, and flesh, which have become skeletons, and the hair, are other members.🔽Touching another member, or scratching, on the nails, etc., are respectively a serious offense and a minor offense.

original: 'di rnams kyis kyang yan lag gzhan la sen mo la sogs pa rnams la reg pa dang ga ga tshil byed pa dag la nyes byas dang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis kyang yan lag gzhan la sen mo la sogs pa rnams la reg pa dang ga ga tshil byed pa dag la nyes byas dang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: Touching another member, or scratching, on the nails, etc., are respectively a minor offense and a slight offense.

original: 'di rnams la ni mngon par zhen pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang nyams pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir nyes byas dang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //🔽mi'i 'gro ba ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams la ni mngon par zhen pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa dang nyams pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir nyes byas dang nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro // mi'i 'gro ba ni tha snyad du bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These are minor offenses and slight offenses because there is no change in the complete development of attachment to them, or in their deterioration, etc.🔽The human realm is to be designated.

original: mi'i 'gro ba 'di la yod pas na mi'i 'gro ba pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba 'di la yod pas na mi'i 'gro ba pa'o //
translated: Because it exists in this human realm, it is the human realm.

original: srog chags dang ldan pa de la tha snyad du bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: srog chags dang ldan pa de la tha snyad du bya ba nyid do //
translated: In the case of a living being, it is conventional.

original: snod du gyur pa'i don dang 'brel pa srog chags su gyur pa rnams la /
analyzed: snod du gyur pa'i don dang 'brel pa srog chags su gyur pa rnams la /
translated: In the case of a living being who is connected with a vessel,

original: 'di ltar mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi'i 'gro bar skyes pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is included in the human realm of rebirth.

original: de dang 'brel pa lhag par spyod pa la ni tha snyad du rdzogs par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa lhag par spyod pa la ni tha snyad du rdzogs par 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the case of one who is connected with that and who is engaged in the practice, it is conventional and is called “complete.”

original: / de'i phyir mi ma yin pa mthu dang mi ldan pa la kun du spyod pa bsngags pa ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mi ma yin pa mthu dang mi ldan pa la kun du spyod pa bsngags pa ni sbom po'o //
translated: Therefore, praising the practice with a non-human who is not powerful is a serious offense.

original: de la 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / bdag nyid la kun du spyod pa bsngags pa dang / 'di la smyan byed pa dang / de la brten par bya ba nyid dang / rten par byed pa nyid gnyis ka la yang 'dir nyes byas so //
analyzed: de la 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / bdag nyid la kun du spyod pa bsngags pa dang / 'di la smyan byed pa dang / de la brten par bya ba nyid dang / rten par byed pa nyid gnyis ka la yang 'dir nyes byas so //
translated: In this case, speaking of sexual intercourse, praising one’s own practice, acting as a matchmaker for this, and both the basis and the act of relying on that are all offenses of wrong conduct.

original: khas ma blangs pas sbyor du bcug pa za pa dang / khas ma blangs pas khas blangs pa'i khyim nas lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa dang / khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa'i khyim nas lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa dag ni nyes byas so //

translated: Taking what is not given is to eat food that was not given to you, to take more than three or four begging bowls from a house where you have been invited to eat, or to take more than three or four begging bowls from a house where you have not been invited to eat.

original: byin len ni rnam pa thams cad du rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pas byas na ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: byin len ni rnam pa thams cad du rang gi phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pas byas na ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: If you do the giving and receiving in a way that is not in accordance with the rules, it is as if you had not done it at all, because the giving and receiving are not valid in any way.

original: khas ma blangs pas khas blangs pa'i zas bsod pa blangs pa zos pa dang / khas blangs pa'i zas bsod pa khas blangs pas zos pa dang / dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa mo la brdeg pa dang / gzas pa dag dang /

translated: Taking what is not given is to eat food that was not given to you, to eat good food that you have accepted from someone who has not been ordained, to eat good food that you have accepted from someone who has been ordained, to strike a nun or a female novice, to threaten to strike a nun or a female novice, to strike a monk, to threaten to strike a monk, to strike a male novice, to threaten to strike a male novice, to strike a lay person, to threaten to strike a lay person, to strike a sentient being that can change into a human being, or to threaten to strike such a being.

translated: The first two are the negative tendencies of those two and the third is the reversal of the nonacceptance of the former by the acceptance of the latter.🔽The fourth is the generation of regret and fear in a fully ordained nun and probationary nun through the nonacceptance of the former by the acceptance of the latter.🔽The fifth is the concealment of the requisites of the nonacceptance of the former by the acceptance of the latter and the theft of what is given.

original: skur pa 'debs pa dag dang / khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa'i yo byad sbed pa dang / byin phrogs byed pa dang / khas ma blangs pas khas blangs pa'i yo byad sbed pa dang / byin phrogs byed pa dang / khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa'i bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba dang /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dag dang / khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa'i yo byad sbed pa dang / byin phrogs byed pa dang / khas ma blangs pas khas blangs pa'i yo byad sbed pa dang / byin phrogs byed pa dang / khas blangs pas khas ma blangs pa'i bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba dang /
translated: The sixth is the concealment of the requisites of the acceptance of the former by the nonacceptance of the latter and the theft of what is given.🔽The seventh is the relinquishment of the training of the acceptance of the former by the nonacceptance of the latter.

original: khas ma blangs pas blangs pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba dang / dag slong ma dang lhan cig dge slong rtsod pa byed pa dang / dge slong ma rnams kyis thun mong ma yin pa ston pa la kho bo 'di la mi slob bo zhes zer ba dag kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pas blangs pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba dang / dag slong ma dang lhan cig dge slong rtsod pa byed pa dang / dge slong ma rnams kyis thun mong ma yin pa ston pa la kho bo 'di la mi slob bo zhes zer ba dag kyang nyes byas so //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is incurred by a monk who does not accept the confession of a nun who has committed a downfall, by a monk who argues with a nun who is reproaching him, and by a monk who says to a nun who is teaching the doctrine, I am not studying under you.

original: 'dir gtogs pa la khyim pa la ni rtags can nyid kyis na smad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gtogs pa la khyim pa la ni rtags can nyid kyis na smad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, a layperson who has the marks of a monk is censured means that a layperson who has not gone forth is censured if he has the marks of a monk.

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi kha na ma tho ba 'dir gtogs pa la khyim pa rab tu ma byung ba'i gang zag gi rtags can ni na smad par yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyi kha na ma tho ba 'dir gtogs pa la khyim pa rab tu ma byung ba'i gang zag gi rtags can ni na smad par yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: A layperson who has not gone forth is censured if he has the marks of a monk, such as the robes of a monk, because he is not fully qualified to have the marks of a monk, such as the robes of a monk, which are the cause of being a monk or a nun.

original: ji ltar 'dir phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la na smad pa bzhin du phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i rgyu mtshan las na smad pa de bas kyang khyim pa la ches na smad par @64b shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la na smad pa bzhin du phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i rgyu mtshan las na smad pa de bas kyang khyim pa la ches na smad par @64b shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the external renunciate is censured here, the householder should be known to be censured even more than the external renunciate, due to the signs of the external renunciate. This is the meaning.

original: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam dag gis ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi med pa dang bag tsam dag gis ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: By the basis and by the mere, there is a minor offense.

original: khyim par gyur pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la skur ba btab pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'jug pa kun nas thob pa'i don dum do 'di byas so //
analyzed: khyim par gyur pa'i skyes pa dang bud med la skur ba btab pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'jug pa kun nas thob pa'i don dum do 'di byas so //
translated: By this, “not having reviled a householder man or woman,” this is done for the purpose of obtaining the complete engagement.

original: mi ma yin pa rtags can ma yin pa la skyon nas smras pa dang phra ma byas pa la ni nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa rtags can ma yin pa la skyon nas smras pa dang phra ma byas pa la ni nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: If one speaks of the faults of a non-human who is not a sign-possessor, and engages in slander, it is a minor offense.

original: mi ma yin pa'i khyim pa rnams la 'phya ba dang / khyim pa'i gnas mal ma brtul bar 'gro ba dang / gang zag la ni gang zhig nyes byas su byas pa de'i bsod nams ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i khyim pa rnams la 'phya ba dang / khyim pa'i gnas mal ma brtul bar 'gro ba dang / gang zag la ni gang zhig nyes byas su byas pa de'i bsod nams ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is a minor offense for a person to commit what is considered a wrong action.

original: mi ma yin pa khyim pa rnams skrod pa dang / de rnams la brdeg pa dang / gzas pa dag dang / khyim pa gzhan gnyis ka la yang sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / de dag la 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dang skur pa 'debs pa yang nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa khyim pa rnams skrod pa dang / de rnams la brdeg pa dang / gzas pa dag dang / khyim pa gzhan gnyis ka la yang sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / de dag la 'gyod pa skyed pa dang / ga ga tshil byed pa dang skur pa 'debs pa yang nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense to drive away householders who are not human, to beat them, to threaten them, to make others do these things, to cause them to regret their faith, to spit at them, or to insult them.

original: 'dir mi ma yin pa dag dang lhan cig pa'i dpe dag la rgyu gnyis kyis na smad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mi ma yin pa dag dang lhan cig pa'i dpe dag la rgyu gnyis kyis na smad par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, in the examples of non-humans, one should understand that they are condemned for two reasons:

original: khyim pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang mi ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang mi ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are householders and because they are not human.

original: rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la ni rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la ni rung ba nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa la sogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The substances of a renunciate are suitable, of proper size, and so on.

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni de rnams kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni de rnams kyi yan lag go //
translated: These two are branches of the first.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma chog pa lan smad pa'i byed pa po nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma chog pa lan smad pa'i byed pa po nyid yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “and so on” means that the agent of the act of disparaging the monk’s requisites is not one who is superior to the monk.

original: lhag pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not one who is equal or inferior.

original: 'dir tshad las lhag pa yan lag yin pa'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshad las lhag pa yan lag yin pa'i gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the scriptural source for the statement that the requisites are of proper size:

original: srin bal gyi stan gyi skabs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i gdan dang tshad bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: srin bal gyi stan gyi skabs nas bde bar gshegs pa'i gdan dang tshad bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “If I make a bed of kapok, or make it the size of the Tathagata’s bed, what is the offense?”

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a downfall requiring relinquishment and confession.”

original: 'dir dge tshul la sogs pa dbang ba'i rdzas rnams la yang yo byad sbed pa dang / gos 'dra ba la sogs pa la cho ga 'di gzhug pa'i don du rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dir dge tshul la sogs pa dbang ba'i rdzas rnams la yang yo byad sbed pa dang / gos 'dra ba la sogs pa la cho ga 'di gzhug pa'i don du rab tu byung ba'i rdzas dag la zhes smos so //
translated: Here, the phrase “the substances of a renunciate” is used in order to include the concealment of requisites belonging to novices and so on, and the use of the procedure in the case of similar cloth and so on.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i zhes ma smos so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i zhes ma smos so //
translated: The term “fully ordained” is not used.

original: chos gos gang zhig tshad las chung ba dang / rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi ba glang dang rnga mo las byung ba dang / ri dags kyi spu dang aa ra ka'i shing bal gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis de dang 'dres pa 'di dag las gzhan pa gnyis sam gang yang rung bas mi rung ba byin gyis brlab pa de bgos pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: chos gos gang zhig tshad las chung ba dang / rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi ba glang dang rnga mo las byung ba dang / ri dags kyi spu dang aa ra ka'i shing bal gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis de dang 'dres pa 'di dag las gzhan pa gnyis sam gang yang rung bas mi rung ba byin gyis brlab pa de bgos pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If the robe is smaller than the prescribed size, or is not suitable because it is made of cow or camel hair, or is mixed with the hair of wild animals or cotton from the aragvata tree, then it is unsuitable if it is made of any of these two or more mixed together.

original: zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang rnying pa dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la khrur bcol ba dang / dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa @65a * //
analyzed: zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang rnying pa dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la khrur bcol ba dang / dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa @65a * //
translated: If one keeps it for more than ten days, or if one asks a nun who is not a relative to wash it,

original: las blangs pa dang / khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las blangs pa dang / ba glang gi spu dang gso ma la sogs pa dang bsres pa'i srin bal dang / lug gi bal nag po shas che ba'i stan byed pa dang /
analyzed: las blangs pa dang / khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las blangs pa dang / ba glang gi spu dang gso ma la sogs pa dang bsres pa'i srin bal dang / lug gi bal nag po shas che ba'i stan byed pa dang /
translated: or if one accepts it from a nun who is not a relative, or from a householder or his wife, or if one makes a cushion of cotton mixed with cow hair or silk, or of black sheep’s wool that is more than one quarter,

original: tha ga pas ma btags pa'i gos dang 'dres ba'i stan byed pa la ma chog pa nyid las kyang na smad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ga pas ma btags pa'i gos dang 'dres ba'i stan byed pa la ma chog pa nyid las kyang na smad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is also reprehensible to make a mat of mixed fibers that is not woven by a weaver.

original: khrus byed pa la sogs pa la ba glang gi spu dang gso ma la sogs pa dang bsres pa'i lug gi bal rnams dang / lhung bzed kha ma bsgyur ba dkar po dag zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang / 'khru ba la rung ba dang /
analyzed: khrus byed pa la sogs pa la ba glang gi spu dang gso ma la sogs pa dang bsres pa'i lug gi bal rnams dang / lhung bzed kha ma bsgyur ba dkar po dag zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang / 'khru ba la rung ba dang /
translated: In the case of bathing and so on, it is a mere offense if one uses wool mixed with cow hair, flax, and so on, or if one keeps an unpainted alms-bowl that is white for more than ten days, or if one washes it with something suitable or unsuitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa 'di dpe bstan pa la yang ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa 'di dpe bstan pa la yang ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: In the case of the analogy, it is not only a mere offense,

original: sbyin par byed pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa la nyes byas so //
translated: but a misdeed if one gives it away.

original: brtad ba las byung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'jog pa dang / dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba ma yin pa dus las sngar tshol ba dang / dus las yol bar 'jog pa dang / gnas mal ma gus par 'gro ba dang / khri dang khri'u rung ba ma yin pa'i rung ba khri'u rkang pa sor brgyad las lhag par byed pa dang /
analyzed: brtad ba las byung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'jog pa dang / dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba ma yin pa dus las sngar tshol ba dang / dus las yol bar 'jog pa dang / gnas mal ma gus par 'gro ba dang / khri dang khri'u rung ba ma yin pa'i rung ba khri'u rkang pa sor brgyad las lhag par byed pa dang /
translated: The third is to keep it after the last day of the sixth month.🔽The fourth is to use a bed or seat without respect.🔽The fifth is to make a bed or bench with legs more than eight standard fingerbreadths high, or to make a bed or bench of precious substances.🔽The sixth is to store food that is not suitable to be kept.

original: de bzhin du rin po che'i khri'am khri'u byed pa dang / zas rung ba ma yin pa gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba rung ba ma yin pa gcer bu dang / gcer bu ma la sbyin pa dang / sbyin du 'jug pa po 'ba' zhig lam zad kyi sbyin par byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin po che'i khri'am khri'u byed pa dang / zas rung ba ma yin pa gsog 'jog byas pa dang / bza' ba dang bca' ba rung ba ma yin pa gcer bu dang / gcer bu ma la sbyin pa dang / sbyin du 'jug pa po 'ba' zhig lam zad kyi sbyin par byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: The seventh is to give or to have someone else give food or drink that is not suitable to be eaten or drunk to naked ascetics or their female counterparts.

original: gos rung ba ma yin pa dang / chung ba kha ma bsgyur bar gyon pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos rung ba ma yin pa dang / chung ba kha ma bsgyur bar gyon pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: The eighth is to wear unsuitable robes or to wear small robes that have not been patched.

original: lhung bzed rin po che las byas pa dang / lhung bzed chung ba dang / chung ba rung ba ma yin pa'i chos gos dang rin po che la sogs pa las byas pa'i khab ral la sogs pa byed pa dang / yo byad rung ba ma yin pa sbed pa dang /🔽nor bu dang / ba so dang / rin po che las byas pa'i khri rkang tshad las lhag par byed pa dang / rin po che la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa las byas pa'i khri dang khri'u la shing bal gyis gos par byed pa dang /
analyzed: lhung bzed rin po che las byas pa dang / lhung bzed chung ba dang / chung ba rung ba ma yin pa'i chos gos dang rin po che la sogs pa las byas pa'i khab ral la sogs pa byed pa dang / yo byad rung ba ma yin pa sbed pa dang / nor bu dang / ba so dang / rin po che las byas pa'i khri rkang tshad las lhag par byed pa dang / rin po che la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa las byas pa'i khri dang khri'u la shing bal gyis gos par byed pa dang /
translated: It is an offense of wrong conduct to make a begging bowl from precious substances, to make a small begging bowl, to make a needle case and so on from precious substances and so forth that are not suitable for Dharma robes, to hide unsuitable articles,🔽to make a bedstead with legs that are more than the prescribed height made of precious substances, to make a bed or bench with legs made of precious substances and so on that are not suitable, to cover it with cotton wool,

original: gos rung ba ma yin pa dang / aarka'i shing bal dang / rnga mo'i bal la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i stan la sogs pa byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos rung ba ma yin pa dang / aarka'i shing bal dang / rnga mo'i bal la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i stan la sogs pa byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: to make unsuitable robes, cushions and so on from unsuitable cotton such as arka cotton and camel wool.

original: gos rung ba ma yin pa tshad las chung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang / khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las len pa dang / @65b lhung bzed gcig slong ba dang / gos gcig 'khrur 'jug pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos rung ba ma yin pa tshad las chung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'chang ba dang / khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma dag las len pa dang / @65b lhung bzed gcig slong ba dang / gos gcig 'khrur 'jug pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: It is also a wrong action to keep for more than ten days a small piece of cloth that is not suitable for robes, to receive gifts from householders and their wives, to ask for a single alms bowl, or to have a single robe washed.

original: gzhan gyi don du byin phrogs byed pa dang / brtad pa las byung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'jog pa dang / dbyar kyi ras chen chung ngu sngar tshol ba dang / phyis 'chang ba dang / gnyis ka las gcig len pa la yang nyes byas so //🔽rang gi don de nyid gtso cher yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du byin phrogs byed pa dang / brtad pa las byung ba zhag bcu las lhag par 'jog pa dang / dbyar kyi ras chen chung ngu sngar tshol ba dang / phyis 'chang ba dang / gnyis ka las gcig len pa la yang nyes byas so // rang gi don de nyid gtso cher yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also a wrong action to steal for the sake of others, to keep for more than ten days what has been obtained through begging, to seek a large or small rainy season retreat robe before the proper time, to keep it after the proper time, or to receive one from both the community and the householders.🔽“One’s own purpose is the most important” means

original: rang gi don de nyid gtso cher yod pa de ni de nyid gtso cher yod pa de la rang gi don nyid yan lag ste /
analyzed: rang gi don de nyid gtso cher yod pa de ni de nyid gtso cher yod pa de la rang gi don nyid yan lag ste /
translated: that one’s own purpose is the most important.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par gyur pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i don 'di yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par gyur pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i don 'di yin /
translated: This is the purpose of completing the practice.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa las kyang dngos gzhi dang mtha' gnas par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa las kyang dngos gzhi dang mtha' gnas par rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: And when that is completed, the actual basis and the conclusion are also established.

original: 'dir dpe brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpe brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here an example should be given:

original: gzhan gyi don du sprod pa las byung ba 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / kun spyod bsngags pa dag ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du sprod pa las byung ba 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / kun spyod bsngags pa dag ni sbom po'o //
translated: For the sake of others, it is a serious offense to engage in sexual intercourse, to speak lies, and to praise one's own conduct.

original: 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la ni nyes byas so //
translated: For the sake of others, it is a minor offense to have others wash oneself, etc.

original: gos dang bal rnams la dge 'dun gyi don du byed du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyi don kho na yin te /
analyzed: gos dang bal rnams la dge 'dun gyi don du byed du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyi don kho na yin te /
translated: For the sake of others, it is also for the sake of the Saṅgha to have others spin wool, etc.

original: rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i don du dge slong gzhan gcig gam du ma'i don du nye bar 'du byas pa'i gos la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i don du dge slong gzhan gcig gam du ma'i don du nye bar 'du byas pa'i gos la ni nyes byas so //
translated: For the sake of both oneself and others, it is a minor offense to have others spin wool, etc. for the sake of one or more other fully ordained monks.

original: de'i 'og tu yo byad gang rnams la rnam par rtog pas thob pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yo byad gang rnams la rnam par rtog pas thob pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: After that, it is a minor offense to obtain goods through conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag dang / sngon ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa dag gi don du byed du bcug pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang / dge sbyong dang bram ze gzhan dag dang / sngon ltung ba byung ba la sogs pa dag gi don du byed du bcug pa la yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, it is for the sake of a nun, a female novice, a female candidate for full ordination, a male novice, a female novice, a male lay practitioner, a female lay practitioner, or other brahmans or ascetics, or for the sake of those who have previously incurred a downfall.

original: dge slong gzhan gcig gam du ma'i don du srin bal dang bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang cha gnyis las lhag par stan byed du 'jug pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gcig gam du ma'i don du srin bal dang bal nag po 'ba' zhig dang cha gnyis las lhag par stan byed du 'jug pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk has a mat made of black wool or of a mixture of one-quarter black wool and more, even for the sake of another monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan gyi don du lhung bzed lhag par tshol ba dang / 'thag tu 'jug pa dang 'thag pa skyed pa dang / khab ral byed du 'jug pa dang / shing bal gyis gos par byed du 'jug pa la sogs pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du lhung bzed lhag par tshol ba dang / 'thag tu 'jug pa dang 'thag pa skyed pa dang / khab ral byed du 'jug pa dang / shing bal gyis gos par byed du 'jug pa la sogs pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk seeks an extra alms bowl for the sake of another, or has one woven, or has one made, or has it dyed, or has it carded, or has it made into a mat, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong ma la des smras pa las len pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma la des smras pa las len pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk receives a bowl from a nun who is not a relative, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed la ni don go ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the case of informative action, it is when the meaning is understood.

original: gang gi rnam par rig byed kyis smras pa dang / gzhan gyis go ba nyid ni yan lag ste /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par rig byed kyis smras pa dang / gzhan gyis go ba nyid ni yan lag ste /
translated: The branch is the speech act that is expressed by the indicative and is understood by another.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa la 'khrig pa dang ldan par smra ba dang / kun du spyod pa @66a * //🔽bsngags pa dag la sbom po'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa la 'khrig pa dang ldan par smra ba dang / kun du spyod pa @66a * // bsngags pa dag la sbom po'o //
translated: Because it is the result of that, it is a serious offense for one who is equipoised to speak of having sex and to praise sexual activity.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gcig las 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong ma la smra bar byed na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig las 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong ma la smra bar byed na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one speaks to a fully ordained nun who is equipoised in the meditative attainment of cessation.”🔽In another text, “to a fully ordained nun who is equipoised” is an example.

original: gzhan las nam snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong ma la zhes bya ba'i dpes snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzhung snga ma gang las sgra byed pa la sogs pas ldang bar mi nus pa nyid du gyur pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa la yang rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las nam snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge slong ma la zhes bya ba'i dpes snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzhung snga ma gang las sgra byed pa la sogs pas ldang bar mi nus pa nyid du gyur pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa la yang rigs pa yin te /
translated: The former text on meditative attainment states that one who is equipoised cannot arise through the power of speech, etc., and it is logical that one who is equipoised would not arise through the power of speech, etc.

original: de bas na gnyis kas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis kas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is included in both.

original: de bzhin du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa dang / glen pa dang 'on pa dag las gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam gyis skur pa 'debs pa la yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa dang / glen pa dang 'on pa dag las gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam gyis skur pa 'debs pa la yang sbom po'o //
translated: Likewise, if one deprecates without a basis, or deprecates slightly, while asleep, or in meditative attainment, or while being a fool or a mute, it is a serious transgression.

original: glen pa dang 'on pa dag dang lhan cig mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo tshong byed pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: glen pa dang 'on pa dag dang lhan cig mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo tshong byed pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one engages in conduct with obvious characteristics together with a fool or a mute, or if one engages in buying and selling, it is a minor infraction.

original: 'thag pa dang 'thag pa skyed du 'jug pa'i phyir gnyis la go bar byed pa dbus pa dang / mtha' 'khob pa dag la skad gzhan gyis skyon nas smras te /
analyzed: 'thag pa dang 'thag pa skyed du 'jug pa'i phyir gnyis la go bar byed pa dbus pa dang / mtha' 'khob pa dag la skad gzhan gyis skyon nas smras te /

original: don ma go na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: don ma go na yang nyes byas so //

original: de gnyis las phra ma byed pa dang / glen pa dang 'on pa gnyis la skyo sdogs byed pa dang / de bzhin du bud med gnyid log pa la chos ston pa dang / skyes pa rkun ma dang mtha' 'khob pa dang gling gzhan las skyes pa dang /

translated: If one engages in divisive speech toward those two, or if one disparages fools and mutes, or if one teaches the doctrine to two women, or to a man who is a thief, a border person, or one born in another continent,

translated: There is an offense if one speaks in a way that is in harmony with those who are asleep, intoxicated, heedless, absorbed in meditation, or mentally disturbed, or with those who are deaf or mute, or if one repeats what another has said.

original: dbus pa dag la skad gzhan gyis bshes ngor byas so zhes skur pa 'debs pa dang / glen pa dang 'on pa dag dang de bzhin du bslang pa la khyad du gsod pa dang / 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa bsgo ba gcog pa la yang nyes byas so //

if one speaks in a way that is in harmony with the deaf and the mute, using a language that they do not understand; if

original: dge slong ma lam bskos par ston pa dang / de dag la zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston to zhes skur pa 'debs pa dang / sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / me 'bud du bcug pa dang / 'gyod pa skyed pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong ma lam bskos par ston pa dang / de dag la zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston to zhes skur pa 'debs pa dang / sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / me 'bud du bcug pa dang / 'gyod pa skyed pa dang /
translated: It is a wrong action to teach a nun who has been appointed a teacher for a while, to disparage her by saying, “I teach her for the sake of just a little food,” to eat food that she has prepared, to light a fire for her, to cause her to have regret,

analyzed: sdangs par byed pa @66b dang ; gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa dang / skad gzhan gyis bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba yang nyes byas so // smra ba po nyid la yod pa ste gsod pa dang rang gi don du rku ba dag las gzhan pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang smra ba'i dngos po ni smra ba nyid du gang zhig rnam par gnas pa smra ba nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i
translated: to frighten her, to disparage her groundlessly and to abandon the training by speaking in a different language.🔽It is a wrong action to kill or steal for one’s own sake or for the sake of another, but not for the sake of a third party.🔽However, the basis of killing is one who is a human or a human being, but not a nonhuman or a nonhuman being.🔽The basis of stealing is the property of another, but not one’s own property.

original: gnod pa yin gyi /

analyzed: lkugs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rjes su ma zhugs pa'i de dag dang 'brel pa smra mi shes shing /
translated: The basis of lying is a human or a human being, but not a nonhuman or a nonhuman being.

original: gang zhig 'di rjes su zhugs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed rdzogs par gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di rjes su zhugs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed rdzogs par gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: One who has entered into this is not one who has completed informative action.

original: mi nus pa la smra ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i phyir rjes su zhugs par gyur pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa la smra ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba'i phyir rjes su zhugs par gyur pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is one who has entered into this one who has entered into the path of action, because one does not speak or go with the intention to kill or steal for one’s own sake.

original: de yang mi gsod pa dang rang gi don du rku ba dag las gzhan pa dag la gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam dag gis skur pa 'de bas pa la ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: de yang mi gsod pa dang rang gi don du rku ba dag las gzhan pa dag la gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam dag gis skur pa 'de bas pa la ni sbom po'o //
translated: If one lies without a basis or just for fun about something other than killing or stealing for one’s own sake, it is a serious transgression.

original: lkugs pa dang lhan cig mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo tshong byed pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: lkugs pa dang lhan cig mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo tshong byed pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one is mute, or if one engages in obvious conduct with another, or if one engages in buying and selling, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'byung ba'i don du 'di zhu bar byed pa 'am ma tshang ba nyid kyis smras pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don du 'di zhu bar byed pa 'am ma tshang ba nyid kyis smras pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one asks about this for the sake of a future event, or if one speaks due to incompleteness, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skyon nas smra ba dang / phra ma byed pa dang / skyo sngogs byed pa dang / ston pa dang klog pa dag dang / de dag la gnas ngan len brjod pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa dang / bshes ngor byas so zhes smra ba dang /
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba dang / phra ma byed pa dang / skyo sngogs byed pa dang / ston pa dang klog pa dag dang / de dag la gnas ngan len brjod pa dang / mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa dang / bshes ngor byas so zhes smra ba dang /
translated: speaking about their faults, engaging in slander, engaging in criticism, teaching and reciting with them, speaking about their negative traits, speaking about things that are beyond the human realm, speaking about being partial,

original: bslab pa khyad du gsod pa dang / 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang / bgo ba gcog pa dang / de dag la ma bskos par ston pa dang / de dag la zang zing cung zad kyi phyir ston to zhes skur ba 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: bslab pa khyad du gsod pa dang / 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang / bgo ba gcog pa dang / de dag la ma bskos par ston pa dang / de dag la zang zing cung zad kyi phyir ston to zhes skur ba 'debs pa dang /

original: sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / de dag me 'bud du bcug pa dang / mi nyan par byed pa dang / de dag gis bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor du bcug pa za ba dang / de dag me 'bud du bcug pa dang / mi nyan par byed pa dang / de dag gis bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba yang nyes byas so //
translated: Eating what they have prepared, making them light the fire, not listening to them, and not accepting their instructions are also faults.

original: yang dag par len par byed pa la ni der ma zad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par len par byed pa la ni der ma zad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For those who are correctly taking up the training, there is more than that.”

original: gang zhig 'di de ma thag pa smra ba po nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba smos pa de ni 'di len pa po'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di de ma thag pa smra ba po nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba smos pa de ni 'di len pa po'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: The one who says, “The one who is present as the speaker of this” is not a limb of the appropriator.

original: 'di ltar go bar byed pa lkugs pa'am smra ba po nyid ma yin pa gzhan dag la yang srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la yang dag par len pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar go bar byed pa lkugs pa'am smra ba po nyid ma yin pa gzhan dag la yang srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la yang dag par len pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who understands, the mute, and others who are not speakers, also have the perfect taking up of abandoning taking life and so on.

original: de ni snod yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽des smra ba po don go bar @67a * //
analyzed: de ni snod yin no zhes bya ba ni / des smra ba po don go bar @67a * //
translated: “That is the vessel” means

analyzed: nus pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de ni yan lag yin gyi /
translated: that the person who is able to understand the meaning of the speaker is a limb.

original: glen pa dang 'on pa dag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: glen pa dang 'on pa dag kyang ma yin la /
translated: But the mute and the deaf are not.

analyzed: de brda mi phrad pa dang / rna ba'i shugs bkag pa dang / sor mo dang des brnga byas na /
translated: If the mute and the deaf are not able to communicate, or if the fingers and the mouth are blocked,

analyzed: lkugs pa dang / rgyu gzhan gyis smra mi shes pa dag kyang rnam par rig byed kyi yan lag ma yin no //
translated: then the mute and those who cannot speak due to other causes are not limbs of the indicative.

original: 'di ltar mdo 'di dag thams cad sngar smra ba po la yod pa ste zhes pa'i mdo des grub zin mod kyi smra ba po nyid la don go bar yod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo 'di dag thams cad sngar smra ba po la yod pa ste zhes pa'i mdo des grub zin mod kyi smra ba po nyid la don go bar yod pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed kyi yan lag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis
translated: This is because the above sutra, “All these sutras exist for the speaker,” has already established this.

analyzed: brjod pa don med pa tsam zhig bstan par zad do //
translated: This sutra merely teaches that speech is meaningless.🔽This sutra was composed in order to teach that there is no fault in not requesting the Dharma from one who does not know the meaning.

original: der zhu ba mi byed pa de la nyes pa med par bstan pa de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: der zhu ba mi byed pa de la nyes pa med par bstan pa de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //

original: 'o na bdag nyid ltung ba bshags pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa gnyis kyi phyir gso bar bya'o zhes gsungs na ma brjod pa la nyes pa med pa ji ltar rung zhe na /🔽de lta bu yang yod mod kyi /

translated: If one is not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and distress,

analyzed: dag gi rnam par rig byed yan lag yin gyi /
translated: If one is not liberated from samsara,

analyzed: spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis la sogs pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: gzhan gyis ni don go bar gsal bar mi nus pa'i phyir cho ga 'di yin no //

analyzed: rang gi'o bdag nyid dang 'brel par ro zhes bya ba ni /
