original: de bas na shin tu chung bar 'di las bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //🔽'dus pa chen po'i tshe gand'i brdungs bas go bar mi 'gyur ba blta na dung sbrel te ;
analyzed: de bas na shin tu chung bar 'di las bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // 'dus pa chen po'i tshe gand'i brdungs bas go bar mi 'gyur ba blta na dung sbrel te ;
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is not taught to be very short.

original: bud par bya'o //
analyzed: bud par bya'o //
translated: When the large gong is struck at the time of the great assembly, if it is not understood, the conch should be blown.🔽The large drum should be beaten.

original: rnga bo che brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: rnga bo che brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: gleng gzhi dag las de rnam pa'i don du zan gyi phyir 'du ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag las de rnam pa'i don du zan gyi phyir 'du ba'i don du zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam du rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase “for the sake of food” in the phrase “for the sake of food, they gather” in the nidana is merely an example.

original: gzhan du yang 'di sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'di sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is applied to other things.

original: gand'i brdungs par mi 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gand'i brdungs par mi 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not fail to go when the gong is struck.”

original: ci yang rung ba blangs pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang rung ba blangs pa'o //
translated: This means that one should go when one is summoned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa la gand'i phyir myur ba kho nar 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gnang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa la gand'i phyir myur ba kho nar 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gnang ngo //
translated: “One should go quickly to the place where the gong is struck for the sake of analysis and so on.”

original: gand'i brdungs par so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir sbran pa yin pas de'i phyir don ci zhig byung zhes nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir der 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gand'i brdungs par so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir sbran pa yin pas de'i phyir don ci zhig byung zhes nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir der 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should go there in order to understand what the matter is, because one is summoned by the striking of the gong.

original: 'dir 'gro ba ni bya ba ste don sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba ni bya ba ste don sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, going is the action, not the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: 'di la dgos pa'i dbang nyid kyi phyir 'os pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la dgos pa'i dbang nyid kyi phyir 'os pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the need is the very power in this case, and because it depends on what is appropriate.

original: mi myur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi myur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not do it too quickly.

original: gand'i phyir myur ba kho nar 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te 'di ni ma mo las so /
analyzed: gand'i phyir myur ba kho nar 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te 'di ni ma mo las so /
translated: One should go quickly for the sake of the sick. This is from the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya.

original: bya ba 'grub @74a * //
analyzed: bya ba 'grub @74a * //
translated: The time for completing the duties🔽is the remainder of the time left.

original: pa'i dus kyi lhag ma lus tsam na rgyun chags gsum pa gdon cing ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa'i dus kyi lhag ma lus tsam na rgyun chags gsum pa gdon cing ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The third recitation should be done at one’s convenience.

original: rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dus ji tsam gyis dge slong spong ba pa dag gis mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba grub pa'i dus kyi lhag ma de tsam lus pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dus ji tsam gyis dge slong spong ba pa dag gis mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sogs pa'i bya ba grub pa'i dus kyi lhag ma de tsam lus pa ni /
translated: The time for completing the duties of the duties of the monks who do prostrations to the stūpa and so forth is the remainder of the time left.

original: rgyun chags gsum pa 'don pa spong ba bdag ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun chags gsum pa 'don pa spong ba bdag ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The third recitation should be done at one’s convenience. This is the meaning of the text.

original: de ran par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ran par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should do it at the right time.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgyun chags gsum pa'o //
translated: “ It” refers to the third recitation.

original: yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should explain the benefits of generosity.

original: rgyun chags gsum bton pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i phan yon bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags gsum bton pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i phan yon bshad par bya'o //
translated: After the third recitation, one should explain the benefits of generosity.

original: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one do that?

original: de'i phyir ran par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ran par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in a timely way.”

original: phyi dro mtshan mo'i mjug tu rang gi gnas su 'gro bar mngon par phyogs pa rnams la de rigs par gyur pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi dro mtshan mo'i mjug tu rang gi gnas su 'gro bar mngon par phyogs pa rnams la de rigs par gyur pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: When they are about to leave the monastery at the end of the night, he sees that they are ready.

original: spong ba pa'i zhal ta pas sngar 'du zhing mjug tu 'gyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spong ba pa'i zhal ta pas sngar 'du zhing mjug tu 'gyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The attendant of the one who is to be expelled should gather them together and then dismiss them.

original: spong ba'i zhal ta byed pas gang de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: spong ba'i zhal ta byed pas gang de rnams kyis so //
translated: The attendant of the one who is to be expelled should gather together the monks who are to carry out the act of expelling him and then dismiss them.

original: gal te rkyen de lta bu byung na lde mig sbas pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te rkyen de lta bu byung na lde mig sbas pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If such a condition arises, the hidden key should be revealed.

original: gal te de lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If such a condition arises” means

original: don gal po che'i dbang gis ma grub pas lde mig gang du sbas pa de bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: don gal po che'i dbang gis ma grub pas lde mig gang du sbas pa de bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: if there is an important matter to be done, the hidden key should be revealed.

original: gal te sngar lde mig 'ga' zhig gi lag tu gzhag gam /
analyzed: gal te sngar lde mig 'ga' zhig gi lag tu gzhag gam /
translated: If previously the key was placed in the hands of someone,

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sbas nas /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sbas nas /
translated: or hidden in a certain place,

original: sngar 'gro mi khom pa de lta bu'i rkyen dag byung na /
analyzed: sngar 'gro mi khom pa de lta bu'i rkyen dag byung na /
translated: and if the condition of an earlier engagement arises,

original: sbed pa po 'gro ba'i phyir gnas skabs bde blag tu byed par mi nus na /
analyzed: sbed pa po 'gro ba'i phyir gnas skabs bde blag tu byed par mi nus na /
translated: If it is not possible to make the situation comfortable by the departure of the one who is hiding,

original: de'i phyir gal te de las spong ba pa gzhan dag mi snang na smra bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de las spong ba pa gzhan dag mi snang na smra bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: then, if the other confessors are not seen, the meaning of the statement is this.

original: 'dir gzhung thams cad kyi sngon du 'ong bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung thams cad kyi sngon du 'ong bar bya'o //
translated: Here, it should come at the beginning of all the texts.

original: gal te de lta bu'i rkyen dag byung na lde mig sba bar bya ba brjod par bya ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i rkyen dag byung na lde mig sba bar bya ba brjod par bya ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: If such conditions arise, the hiding of the key should be stated, should be revealed.

original: tshe dang ldan pas phyogs 'di na lde mig sbas pa bltas nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pas phyogs 'di na lde mig sbas pa bltas nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with life should look at the hidden key in this direction and take it out.

original: gso sbyong gi gzhi las zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong gi skabs so //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gzhi las zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong gi skabs so //
translated: This is the section on the poṣadha of tranquility from the basis of the poṣadha.

original: gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba smos nas /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas la blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba smos nas /
translated: Having said, We should agree on the site for the poṣadha,

original: gnas ji lta bur blo mthun par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ji lta bur blo mthun par bya zhe na /
translated: if it is asked, On what kind of site should we agree?

original: de'i phyir gnas thams cad grub pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas thams cad grub pa'am /
translated: for that reason it is said, On a site that is completed,

original: byas pa'am zin pa la 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byas pa'am zin pa la 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: or one that is made, or one that is finished.

original: gnas gang la thams cad grub pa'am /
analyzed: gnas gang la thams cad grub pa'am /
translated: On whatever site all are completed,

original: thams cad byas pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad byas pa'am /
translated: or all are made,🔽or all are finished,

original: thams cad zin @74b ba yod pa de ni gang la zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa'o /🔽de la grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa'i bskal pa tshe rang grub pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad zin @74b ba yod pa de ni gang la zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa'o / de la grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa'i bskal pa tshe rang grub pa'am /
translated: That which is established, produced, and completed is included by the phrase “whatever exists.”

original: gtib chad pa la sogs pas rang grub pa ste /
analyzed: gtib chad pa la sogs pas rang grub pa ste /
translated: Here, that which is established is that which is established by itself, either through the eon of creation or through the power of karma.🔽Or, that which is established by itself through the power of causes and conditions, such as the coming together of the parts of a pot.

original: dper na ri'i bya skyibs la sogs pa lta bu gzhan gyis byas pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //🔽byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dper na ri'i bya skyibs la sogs pa lta bu gzhan gyis byas pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro // byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa la brten nas /
translated: For example, a mountain, a cliff, and so on, are not dependent on being made by another.

original: bsgrub pa gang yin pa'o //🔽zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub pa gang yin pa'o // zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is produced is that which is accomplished in dependence on effort.

original: bya ba byed pa'i gnas la sogs par rung ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i gnas la sogs par rung ba ste /
translated: That which is completed is that which is fit for action, such as a field, and so on.

original: grub pa dang byas pa dang zin pa la'o zhes bya ba 'di yongs su rdzogs pa de bas na grub pa la sogs pa ni ming gi rnam grangs nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa dang byas pa dang zin pa la'o zhes bya ba 'di yongs su rdzogs pa de bas na grub pa la sogs pa ni ming gi rnam grangs nyid do //
translated: That which is established, produced, and completed is completely perfected. Therefore, established and so on are synonyms.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa la yang 'di dag gi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa la yang 'di dag gi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: These terms are also used for that which is not completely perfected.

original: de'i phyir bye brag 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the distinction.

original: phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge 'dun las phyi rol du gyur ba'i nyen kor du 'dom gang tsam dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nye 'khor 'dom gang dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni / dge 'dun las phyi rol du gyur ba'i nyen kor du 'dom gang tsam dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol nyen kor 'dom gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is endowed with an external area one arm span in size means🔽that which is one arm span in size outside of the Saṅgha is called endowed with an external area one arm span in size.

original: nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyen kor 'dom gang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is endowed with an area one arm span in size means

original: mtha'i sgra ni 'dir drang srong gis gsungs pa las 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha'i sgra ni 'dir drang srong gis gsungs pa las 'don pa yin te /
translated: that the word area is used here in the sense of the sage's statement.

original: de'i don ni bar dang bcas par gyur pa dang lhan cig tu de tsam pa'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i nye 'khor zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni bar dang bcas par gyur pa dang lhan cig tu de tsam pa'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i nye 'khor zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is said to be an external area of that size, together with an intermediate space.

original: ci mi 'dod bzhin du yang blo mthun par bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci mi 'dod bzhin du yang blo mthun par bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Is it to be done in agreement even if one does not wish it?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir dge 'dun 'dod na'o //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir dge 'dun 'dod na'o //
translated: No, it is not. Therefore it says, If the Saṅgha wishes.🔽It is also the site of other rites means

original: las gzhan gyi gnas kyang de yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: las gzhan gyi gnas kyang de yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that it is also the site of other rites.

original: gso sbyong gi gnas zhes smos pas 'dir las gzhan der mi bya ba'am snyam du sems pa rnams kyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'di'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas zhes smos pas 'dir las gzhan der mi bya ba'am snyam du sems pa rnams kyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir 'di'o //
translated: Since it is said in the basis of the poṣadha, some think, Here one should not do any other action than that. In order to dispel that doubt, it is said:

original: 'dir gso sbyong zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gso sbyong zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the word poṣadha

original: dpe tsam du zad de de bas na las rnams tha dad par gnas pa nyid ces bya ba gso sbyong gi gzhi las de bcas pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dpe tsam du zad de de bas na las rnams tha dad par gnas pa nyid ces bya ba gso sbyong gi gzhi las de bcas pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: is merely an example. Therefore, it is said that the actions remain distinct, because it is prescribed in the basis of the poṣadha.

original: mtshams gcad par bya'o //🔽dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad du'o zhes bya ba la /🔽byed ces bya ba ni ji srid dang lhan du sbyar ba 'di ste /
analyzed: mtshams gcad par bya'o // dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad du'o zhes bya ba la / byed ces bya ba ni ji srid dang lhan du sbyar ba 'di ste /
translated: One should establish the boundary.🔽Up to the limit of one and a half yojanas.

original: de srid dpag tshad phyed dang gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de srid dpag tshad phyed dang gsum zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, one is connected with and, and it means up to one and a half yojanas.

original: phyogs phyogs su pha bong dang / rtsig pa dang / ka ba dang / shing ljon pa dang / ra ba dang / bya skyibs dang / lam po che dang / khron pa la sogs pa de shes pa'i dge slong rnams kyis brtags nas dge 'dun gyi mdun du mtshan ma brtan po brjod @75a * //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs su pha bong dang / rtsig pa dang / ka ba dang / shing ljon pa dang / ra ba dang / bya skyibs dang / lam po che dang / khron pa la sogs pa de shes pa'i dge slong rnams kyis brtags nas dge 'dun gyi mdun du mtshan ma brtan po brjod @75a * //
translated: In all directions, the monks who know about the stone, wall, pillar, tree, fence, overhang, main road, well, etc. should examine it and then state the stable sign in front of the Saṅgha.

original: de las bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “From that, it should be done.”

original: de shes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni yul de na gnas pa'am /🔽gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de shes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni yul de na gnas pa'am / gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Those who know about it” refers to those who live in that place.🔽“Those who live there” refers to those who live there permanently.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gnas pa de'am /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gnas pa de'am /
translated: “Those who live there” refers to those who live there or

original: phyi rol du mngon par shes pa ma grub pa las sngar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du mngon par shes pa ma grub pa las sngar gnas pa'o //
translated: those who live outside who have not previously established supernormal knowledge.

original: sngar pha bong la sogs pa mtshan ma brtan po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'phangs pa rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: sngar pha bong la sogs pa mtshan ma brtan po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'phangs pa rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: “The stable sign of the stone, etc.” refers to the exclusion of what is thrown.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed tsam la brtan po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed tsam la brtan po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni brjod pa'o //
translated: “The stable sign, etc.” refers to what is stated in the mere act of engagement.

original: 'dis rnam par bcad nas yun ring du gnas pa brjod pa la yin te /
analyzed: 'dis rnam par bcad nas yun ring du gnas pa brjod pa la yin te /
translated: This is said to be a long-lasting exclusion.

original: don las ji ltar yun ring du yongs su shes pa bsgrub pa de ltar gong du yang mtshan ma gzhan nges par zhugs pa mngon par 'du byas pas bya'o zhes bya ba smos pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: don las ji ltar yun ring du yongs su shes pa bsgrub pa de ltar gong du yang mtshan ma gzhan nges par zhugs pa mngon par 'du byas pas bya'o zhes bya ba smos pa de'i phyir /
translated: As much as one is able to fully understand the meaning, one should also engage in other signs in the future through manifest effort.

original: gang zhig gang du gzhan sgrub par 'gyur pa de bas na re zhig 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du byed pa der na par sgrub pa la mtshan ma zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du gzhan sgrub par 'gyur pa de bas na re zhig 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du byed pa der na par sgrub pa la mtshan ma zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, when one thinks, “May it occur in such a place,” that is called a sign for establishing what is to be accomplished.

original: pha bong ngam phur pa gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: pha bong ngam phur pa gdab pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: When one thinks, “I will throw a stone or stake, etc.,” that is included in this.

original: der gnang ba byas na chos gos dag dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der gnang ba byas na chos gos dag dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one obtains permission there, one will not be separated from one’s robes.

original: der zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang du'o //
translated: “There” means within the boundary.

original: gal te chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byas par gyur na 'dir chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba byas par gyur na 'dir chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If he has received permission not to be separated from his robes, he will not be separated from his robes here.

original: mtshams bcad pa tsam chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa tsam chos gos dang mi 'bral bar gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not just the demarcation of the boundary that is the permission not to be separated from the robes.

original: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽chos gos dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba de bya ste /
analyzed: de bya'o zhes bya ba ni / chos gos dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba de bya ste /
translated: That should be done means🔽that the permission not to be separated from the robes should be done.

original: chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba de byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba de byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: That permission not to be separated from the robes should be done.

original: de la byed pa gnang ba ma yin no snyam du 'ga' zhig sems so zhes smos so //🔽thams cad kyi ched du dkyil 'khor bar blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la byed pa gnang ba ma yin no snyam du 'ga' zhig sems so zhes smos so // thams cad kyi ched du dkyil 'khor bar blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some think, That is not the permission to do it.🔽For all purposes, the boundary should be agreed upon means

original: las thams cad la brten nas gso sbyong gi rjes la dkyil 'khor blo mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad la brten nas gso sbyong gi rjes la dkyil 'khor blo mthun par bya'o //
translated: that after the Poṣadha, the boundary should be agreed upon in dependence on all the actions.

original: snga ma bag yangs su ma byas pa bcad pa gzhan mi 'chags so zhes bya ba sngar gyi mtshams bag yangs su ma byas pa la mchoms gzhan mi 'chags so //
analyzed: snga ma bag yangs su ma byas pa bcad pa gzhan mi 'chags so zhes bya ba sngar gyi mtshams bag yangs su ma byas pa la mchoms gzhan mi 'chags so //
translated: The former, not having relaxed the boundary, does not establish another.

original: de lta bas na dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams su blo mthun par ma byas par mtshams bcad pa'i blos mthun par byed 'dod pa la @75b mtshams dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams su blo mthun par ma byas par mtshams bcad pa'i blos mthun par byed 'dod pa la @75b mtshams dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if one wishes to establish a boundary in the mandala without having made an agreement with the mandala, one should release the boundary.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du shes par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not think that this is unreasonable.

original: de'i phyir mtshams dag dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshams dag dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the boundaries should be released.

original: mtshams po che'i steng du dkyil 'khor ba mi 'chags pas de dgrol nas bya'o //🔽tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis bcad pa dang dgrol du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams po che'i steng du dkyil 'khor ba mi 'chags pas de dgrol nas bya'o // tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis bcad pa dang dgrol du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since the mandala is not established above the boundary, it should be done after releasing it.🔽It is suitable to release both boundaries with one statement.

original: mtshams gnyis po dag la tshig gcig gis bcad pa'am dgrol bar rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshams gnyis po dag la tshig gcig gis bcad pa'am dgrol bar rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to release both boundaries with one statement.

original: mtshams gnyis kar dge 'dun bkod nas las byed pa'i dge slong gis mtshams gnyis kar shing ngam dbyug pa'am re ldes mnan nas gsol ba bya ste las bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams gnyis kar dge 'dun bkod nas las byed pa'i dge slong gis mtshams gnyis kar shing ngam dbyug pa'am re ldes mnan nas gsol ba bya ste las bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The monks who perform the rite should be placed in both the old and new boundaries. The rite should be performed by pressing down with a stick, a staff, or a rope in both boundaries.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas su ni las la rtsig pa mtshams yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas su ni las la rtsig pa mtshams yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In a place where the boundaries have not been established, the wall of the monastery is the boundary for the rite.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnag gang yin pa der las bya ba'i yul la gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa nyid mtshams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnag gang yin pa der las bya ba'i yul la gtsug lag khang gi rtsig pa nyid mtshams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in a place where the boundaries have not been established, the wall of the monastery itself is the boundary for the place where the rite is performed.

original: 'dir chos gos dang 'bral ba'i mtshams bsal ba'i phyir la zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir chos gos dang 'bral ba'i mtshams bsal ba'i phyir la zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the word “if” is stated to exclude the boundary of separation from the robes.

original: de la cho ga yin no //
analyzed: de la cho ga yin no //
translated: The rite is performed there.

original: dbyar gyi mtshams bcad pa la khas blangs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mtshams so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi mtshams bcad pa la khas blangs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mtshams so //
translated: The boundary of the rainy season retreat is the boundary here.

original: khas blangs pa yang las te gang gi phyir 'dir las kyi gzhir spyir bstan pa bzung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa yang las te gang gi phyir 'dir las kyi gzhir spyir bstan pa bzung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The promise is the rite, because here the general teaching is not taken as the basis of the rite.

original: 'on kyang thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa la'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa la'o //
translated: But all of them are established after the determination of the boundary.

original: de ltar yang mtshams 'dir rnyed pa bgo ba dang shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlabs pa yang de lta bu'i rnam pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang mtshams 'dir rnyed pa bgo ba dang shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlabs pa yang de lta bu'i rnam pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: In this way, the distribution of the acquired property and the consecration of the property of the deceased are also of that kind.

original: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' gtsug lag khang nas thag ring po na 'dug pas kho bo mtshams su gtogs pas rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' gtsug lag khang nas thag ring po na 'dug pas kho bo mtshams su gtogs pas rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the venerable Upasena, being far from the monastery, said, “I am within the boundary, so I am entitled to the acquired property.”

original: nang du 'tshed pa dang smig pa dag la sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nang du 'tshed pa dang smig pa dag la sgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of cooking and boiling within?

original: gnas su 'di dag la mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas su 'di dag la mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: There is disagreement about this in the treatises.

original: de lta bas na ji srid gnas kyi blo yod pa de srid du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji srid gnas kyi blo yod pa de srid du zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “as long as the idea of a dwelling exists.”

original: de yang phyi rol 'dom gang dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang phyi rol 'dom gang dang bcas pa'o //
translated: And that includes the surrounding area of one fathom.

original: gzhi med pa'i gnas su ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i gnas su ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done in a place without a basis?

original: ji srid du der lhag par gnas pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa de srid spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du der lhag par gnas pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa de srid spang bar bya'o //
translated: As long as it is established by the nature of remaining there, it should be abandoned.

original: dge slong grong dag tu dge slong rnams kyi don du nye bar mi mkho ba'i gnas rnams gang yin par byed pa de rnams la ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong grong dag tu dge slong rnams kyi don du nye bar mi mkho ba'i gnas rnams gang yin par byed pa de rnams la ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done about those who are not monks but who act like monks in the villages?

original: @76a * // gang zhig der dge slong rnams kyi gnas don du de nye 'khor dang bcas pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: @76a * // gang zhig der dge slong rnams kyi gnas don du de nye 'khor dang bcas pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: The monastery should be abandoned together with its surroundings if it is used for the sake of the monks.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The same should be done for others.

original: wa nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: wa nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Where water drips from a bamboo pipe,

original: wa nas chu 'dzag pa ni rnams kyi ni smyug ma bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: wa nas chu 'dzag pa ni rnams kyi ni smyug ma bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The water dripping from a bamboo pipe is included in the monastery itself, like a bamboo pipe.

original: de bas na khyams bzhin du de'i 'og cha 'di zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na khyams bzhin du de'i 'og cha 'di zhugs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this lower part is included in the monastery, like a courtyard.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gal gnyis su btags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gal gnyis su btags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The word also indicates that it is not just a courtyard,

original: gang du wa nas chu 'dzag pa yod pa de la ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang du wa nas chu 'dzag pa yod pa de la ni 'di yin no //
translated: but where there is a bamboo pipe, that is also included.

original: gzhan la ni rtsig pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni rtsig pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Wall is mentioned for the sake of illustration.

original: mtshams de'am 'di zhes bya ba wa nas chu 'dzag pa'i wa yin no //🔽grong la nyen kor gyi mtha' tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams de'am 'di zhes bya ba wa nas chu 'dzag pa'i wa yin no // grong la nyen kor gyi mtha' tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The boundary of a village is the edge of the area where water falls from a full bucket.

original: grong la sngar 'bral ba'i skabs su grong gi nyen kor bsten pa gang yin pa de'i mtha' tshun chad mtshams yin te /
analyzed: grong la sngar 'bral ba'i skabs su grong gi nyen kor bsten pa gang yin pa de'i mtha' tshun chad mtshams yin te /
translated: The boundary of a village is the edge of the area where water falls from a full bucket.

original: 'dir gzhung ni lung sil bu dag pas gsungs pa yin no //🔽dgon pa la ni phyogs phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni lung sil bu dag pas gsungs pa yin no // dgon pa la ni phyogs phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun chad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text here is from the Kṣudraka-āgama.🔽In the wilderness, it is the edge of the area within earshot in each direction.

original: dgon pa la dbus nas brtsams te zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir phyogs phyogs su zhes smos so //
analyzed: dgon pa la dbus nas brtsams te zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir phyogs phyogs su zhes smos so //
translated: In the wilderness, the boundary is the edge of the area within earshot in each direction.🔽The text here is from the Kṣudraka-āgama.

original: gso sbyong gi gzhi las gnas kyi skabs so /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gzhi las gnas kyi skabs so /
translated: The section on the wilderness is finished.

original: // /'dir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye'i don du mdzad de 'dun pa 'bul ba gsungs mod kyi tshogs par gtogs pa gzhan thams cad la yang yod pas /
analyzed: // /'dir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye'i don du mdzad de 'dun pa 'bul ba gsungs mod kyi tshogs par gtogs pa gzhan thams cad la yang yod pas /
translated: Here, the text explains the offering of one’s consent for the purpose of the poṣadha and the invitation ceremony. However, this is also done for all other assemblies.

original: las thams cad la rnam par gnas pa de bas na thams cad kyi dbang du bya ste bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las thams cad la rnam par gnas pa de bas na thams cad kyi dbang du bya ste bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since he is present for all actions, he is the one who should be appointed to all of them.

original: 'dun pa 'bul bas las de dang mthun pa 'grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dun pa 'bul bas las de dang mthun pa 'grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The action is accomplished in accordance with the intention that is offered.”

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa gang yin pa'i gang zag des so //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa gang yin pa'i gang zag des so //
translated: “That” refers to the person who offers the intention.

original: mtshams bcad pa'i las ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa'i las ni mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The action of the boundary is not accomplished”

original: 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshogs pa mthun pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'dun pa 'bul bar byed pa de'i tshogs pa mthun pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: means that the assembly of those who offer the intention is not accomplished.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor las thams cad la 'dun pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor las thams cad la 'dun pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Here, the text says, “Upāli, all actions are accompanied by intention,

original: mtshams bcad pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: except for the action of the boundary.”

original: gleng gzhi dag las de la sogs pa 'dun pa 'bul ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag las de la sogs pa 'dun pa 'bul ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: In the nidāna, it says, “The intention is offered, and so on, up to the conclusion.”

original: bslab pa byin pa las de blang du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa las de blang du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The training is given, and it is proper to take it up”

original: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dun pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dun pa bzang ngo //
translated: means that here the word “that” refers to the good intention.

original: bslab pa byin pa las 'dun pa blang ba su la rung zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa las 'dun pa blang ba su la rung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked to whom is it proper to take the vow of training from one who has given the vow of training,

original: @76b de'i phyir de la dge slong gi 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @76b de'i phyir de la dge slong gi 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: therefore it is said, “in relation to that, in the presence of the perception of a fully ordained monk.”

original: bslab pa byin pa de la dge slong gi 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa de la dge slong gi 'du shes so //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa de la dge slong gi 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa de la dge slong gi 'du shes so //
translated: In relation to that one who has given the vow of training, in the presence of the perception of a fully ordained monk, there is the perception of a fully ordained monk.

original: de nye bar gnas pa gang gis de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nye bar gnas pa gang gis de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that which is present, it is the meaning of “from that.”

original: dbul du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bslab pa byin pa de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ste /
analyzed: dbul du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bslab pa byin pa de la 'dun pa dbul du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to give” means it is not proper to give the vow of training to that one who has given the vow of training.

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa 'dir yang ma yin zhes bya ba bye brag med par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa 'dir yang ma yin zhes bya ba bye brag med par gtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, in the saṅgha, it is not proper to give the vow of training to one who is not a fully ordained monk.

original: yongs su dag pa dag dgag dbye dag la yang 'dis byas par 'gyur zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dag dgag dbye dag la yang 'dis byas par 'gyur zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is also done for the purification and the lifting of restrictions.

original: smyos pa'i gnang ba thob pas ni mi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smyos pa'i gnang ba thob pas ni mi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has obtained permission to be insane does not become non-virtuous.

original: yongs su dag pa phul ba dang yang gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa phul ba dang yang gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the same as offering purification.

original: 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: The word “also” is stated because it is accomplished.

original: gang dang lhan cig pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la dge 'dun dang zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la dge 'dun dang zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Together with” is understood implicitly here as “together with the Saṅgha.”

original: don gang la gcig nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don gang la gcig nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: With regard to what object is there unity?

original: de'i phyir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “with regard to the poṣadha and the pravāraṇa.”

original: gcig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “There is unity” is to be supplied.

original: ci zhig byas pas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas pas she na /
translated: What is done?

original: de'i phyir de phul bas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de phul bas so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “by offering that.”

original: yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye phul bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye phul bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: by offering the purification and the pravāraṇa.

original: de bzhin du de gnyis la'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnyis la'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, with regard to those two.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye 'bul ba dag gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye 'bul ba dag gis so //
translated: “Similarly” means by offering the purification and the pravāraṇa.

original: de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la'o //
translated: “With regard to those two” means with regard to the poṣadha and the pravāraṇa.

original: rtogs pa po la cho ga 'di legs pa nyid du bstan gyi dge 'dun du longs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po la cho ga 'di legs pa nyid du bstan gyi dge 'dun du longs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: This rite is taught for the one who understands, not for one who is not a monk.

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: cho gnod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: cho gnod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, The rite should be performed.

original: yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye phral bas gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gnyis bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang dgag dbye phral bas gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gnyis bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite is the procedure for performing the two, the poṣadha and the pravāraṇa, by means of the purification and the separation.

original: tshogs tha dad pas 'dun pa la sogs pas mthun par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs tha dad pas 'dun pa la sogs pas mthun par bya ste /
translated: By means of the different assemblies, the consent, etc. should be made harmonious.

original: las byed pa la mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las byed pa la mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not proper for the one who performs the rite means

original: bkod pa sna tshogs pa bcings par gyur pa nyid kyis de la mi rigs pa'i blo skye ba ste ;
analyzed: bkod pa sna tshogs pa bcings par gyur pa nyid kyis de la mi rigs pa'i blo skye ba ste ;
translated: that because of being bound by various arrangements, an improper understanding arises for him.

original: de bsal ba'i don du 'di'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i don du 'di'o //
translated: For the purpose of dispelling that, this is stated.

original: 'dir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa 'bul ba'i skabs ma yin par shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa 'bul ba'i skabs ma yin par shes par mi bya ste /
translated: Here, one should not understand that it is not the occasion for offering consent, etc. without fault.

original: 'di nad pa la sogs pa dbang po nyid rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nad pa la sogs pa dbang po nyid rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the sick, etc. are suitable to be the sense faculties themselves.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text is from the question:

original: btsun pa dge slong phyogs @77a * //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong phyogs @77a * //
translated: Venerable monk,

original: gcig na mchis pas gnas bzhi po dag tu so sor thar pa'i mdo bton pa la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gcig na mchis pas gnas bzhi po dag tu so sor thar pa'i mdo bton pa la gso sbyong yang bgyis par 'gyur zhing /
translated: is it the case that a monk who is in one place recites the Sūtra of Individual Liberation in the four places and also performs the purification ceremony,

original: dge slong de dag la yang 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: dge slong de dag la yang 'gal tshabs can du mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: and that the monks there do not commit an offense?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, it is possible.

original: 'di ltar so sor thar ba'i med 'don pa'i dge slong gi gnas bzhi po dag cig car du shing ngam /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor thar ba'i med 'don pa'i dge slong gi gnas bzhi po dag cig car du shing ngam /
translated: It is like this: if the monk who recites the Sūtra of Individual Liberation simultaneously presses down on the four places with a stick,

original: dbyug pa'am / re ldes mnan te so sor thar ba'i mdo 'don na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyug pa'am / re ldes mnan te so sor thar ba'i mdo 'don na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a club, or a stone, he recites the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.🔽There is no such thing as simultaneously expressing similar things that are to be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ba rtsom pa 'dra ba rnams cig car brjod pa la yang med do zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rtsom pa 'dra ba rnams cig car brjod pa la yang med do zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected to the statement “there is no impropriety.”

original: cig car zhes bya ba ni thabs cig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba ni thabs cig gis bsgrub par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Simultaneously means that they are to be accomplished by the same means. This is the meaning.

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis lhan cig tu 'dun pa dang dgag dbye dag la yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gnyis lhan cig tu 'dun pa dang dgag dbye dag la yang brjod do //
translated: That which is said in general, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.🔽That which is said, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.🔽That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.🔽That which is said, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.🔽That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.

original: brjod par bya ba rtsom pa 'dra ba rnams zhes spyir smos pa gang yin pa de la rig pa ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dang / 'dun pa dang dgag dbye dag kyang brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis ni yul gyi bye brag la bcas pa zhes bya ba de lta bur gzhan rnams la yang 'dir khongs su bsdu ba'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin
analyzed: brjod par bya ba rtsom pa 'dra ba rnams zhes spyir smos pa gang yin pa de la rig pa ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dang / 'dun pa dang dgag dbye dag kyang brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis ni yul gyi bye brag la bcas pa zhes bya ba de lta bur gzhan rnams la yang 'dir khongs su bsdu ba'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin
translated: That which is said, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.

original: no // gcig gis du ma'i de dag len pa la yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: no // gcig gis du ma'i de dag len pa la yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.🔽That which is said, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.

original: mi rung ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mi rung ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.🔽That which is said, “those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter,” is that the Saṅgha should be informed by those who are similar in the composition of the subject matter, such as intention and purification, intention and the lifting of restrictions.🔽That which is said, “one should also inform the Saṅgha,” is included in this.

original: dge song gcig gis dge slong du ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dun pa dang / dgag dbye la sogs pa len pa yang mi rung ba med do //
analyzed: dge song gcig gis dge slong du ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dun pa dang / dgag dbye la sogs pa len pa yang mi rung ba med do //
translated: There is no fault in one monk taking the intention, the invitation ceremony, etc. that belong in the mindstreams of many monks.

original: 'di la brjod nus pa'i tshig gis gzung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la brjod nus pa'i tshig gis gzung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is grasped by the words that are able to express it.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dge slong du ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa len pa 'di la grangs kyi bye brag yongs su chad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dge slong du ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa len pa 'di la grangs kyi bye brag yongs su chad pa med do //
translated: In this, there is no definite number of the particulars of the intention, etc. that belong in the mindstreams of many monks.

original: 'on kyang brjod nus pa las te ji snyed brjod nus pa de snyed pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod nus pa las te ji snyed brjod nus pa de snyed pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is by the words that are able to express it. The meaning is that it is by however many words are able to express it.

original: mi nus na de dag 'bul ba gang yang rung bas 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus na de dag 'bul ba gang yang rung bas 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is not able, it is accomplished by any of the offerings.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa de rnams 'bul ba gang yin pa de rnams la gang yang rung bas mi nus par gyur na 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa de rnams 'bul ba gang yin pa de rnams la gang yang rung bas mi nus par gyur na 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by any of the offerings of those intentions, etc. if one is not able to do them all.

original: lus kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: lus kyis kyang ngo //
translated: It is also by the body.

original: ji ltar yang mi nus na yang na dge 'dun der 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi nus na yang na dge 'dun der 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If one is not able to do it at all, one should go to that Saṃgha.

original: yang na de khris blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar yang zhes @77b bya ba la ni lus kyis kyang mi nus par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: yang na de khris blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar yang zhes @77b bya ba la ni lus kyis kyang mi nus par 'gyur na'o //
translated: Or else, “in any way” means that he should not do so even by body.

original: yang na de zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'bul ba'i nad pa la'o //
analyzed: yang na de zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'bul ba'i nad pa la'o //
translated: Or else, “that” refers to the patient who is offering his desire, etc.

original: de blangs pas rgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de blangs pas rgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By accepting it, he should not run”

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: means that he should not do so by desire, etc.

original: mgyogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgyogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “He should not go quickly”

original: la la dag ni mgyogs pa dang rgyug pa dag gis gnas la mgyogs pa dang / rgyug par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la dag ni mgyogs pa dang rgyug pa dag gis gnas la mgyogs pa dang / rgyug par mi bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: means that some say that he should not go quickly or run in a place where he might go quickly or run.

original: don de nyid 'dir mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: don de nyid 'dir mthong ba yin no //
translated: This very meaning is seen here.

original: rtse ba'i ngo bos cung zad dal ba'i 'gro bas tshig dang bcas pas rgyug pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rtse ba'i ngo bos cung zad dal ba'i 'gro bas tshig dang bcas pas rgyug pa mthong ba'o //
translated: He sees running with speech, with a gait that is slightly slow due to the nature of play.

original: tshig dang bcas pa'i mgyogs pa'ang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang bcas pa'i mgyogs pa'ang mthong ba yin no //
translated: He also sees going quickly with speech.

original: rgyug pa ni de nyid steng gi cha la bsnyen nas mchong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rgyug pa ni de nyid steng gi cha la bsnyen nas mchong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Running is that itself, approaching the upper part and having the nature of jumping, etc.

original: mchong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchong bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not jump.

original: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'obs la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'obs la'o //
translated: One should not jump over an outer wall.🔽One should not jump down from a terrace.

original: bang rim la ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchong ba ste /🔽phyi rol gyi khyams kyi bang rim la'o //
analyzed: bang rim la ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mchong ba ste / phyi rol gyi khyams kyi bang rim la'o //
translated: One should not jump down from a terrace of an outer courtyard.

original: nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽nam mkha' la 'jug pa'am /🔽'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / nam mkha' la 'jug pa'am / 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not stand in space.🔽One should not enter space.🔽One should not go in space.

original: phyi rol du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o //🔽skas kyi rim pa gzhan ba zhag nas gzhan du gom pa dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mtshams nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya'o // skas kyi rim pa gzhan ba zhag nas gzhan du gom pa dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go outside the boundary.🔽One should not step from one stair to another stair.

original: them skas kyi them par mi bya'o //
analyzed: them skas kyi them par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not step on the steps of a staircase.

original: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bathe in water that reaches above the chest.

original: gnyid log pa dang snyoms par 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang snyoms par 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sleep or enter meditative attainment.

original: de gnyis ni ma bklas pa nyid kyis kyang smad par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis ni ma bklas pa nyid kyis kyang smad par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: These two are reprehensible even if not recited.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa gzung ba gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa la sogs pa gzung ba gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la'o //
translated: The two are the one who is asleep and the one who is in meditative equipoise, who are the objects of the desire, etc.

original: ma bklas pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bklas pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “without having recited” means

original: the tshom za ba nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / ma mos pa nyid dang bstan pa la ma gus pa nyid do //
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid dang / ma nges pa nyid dang / ma mos pa nyid dang bstan pa la ma gus pa nyid do //
translated: doubt, uncertainty, lack of faith, and lack of respect for the teachings.

original: des na gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa 'di dag la smad par bya ba nyid do //🔽ltung ba 'byin pa po nyid kyis ngo tsha ba med pa 'ba' zhig ma zad kyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro ba la skyon dang bcas pa nyid kyi rjes su bsgrub pa la gtogs pa'i lo rgyus la so sor nub pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa 'di dag la smad par bya ba nyid do // ltung ba 'byin pa po nyid kyis ngo tsha ba med pa 'ba' zhig ma zad kyi mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro ba la skyon dang bcas pa nyid kyi rjes su bsgrub pa la gtogs pa'i lo rgyus la so sor nub pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, these two, the one who is asleep and the one who is in meditative equipoise, are to be censured.🔽Not only is the one who commits the downfall shameless, but also the one who goes outside the boundary is at fault.

original: 'di dag la ni 'di so sor mi gnang bar 'gyur ba de bas na 'di dag kho na las ma bklas pa nyid kyis kyang smad par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni 'di so sor mi gnang bar 'gyur ba de bas na 'di dag kho na las ma bklas pa nyid kyis kyang smad par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The story is not to be told to those who are not monks, but it is not forbidden to tell it to them. Therefore, it is to be censured just because it is not to be recited.

original: dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya @78a * //
analyzed: dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya @78a * //
translated: One should tell the fully ordained monks.🔽

original: ba ni / 'dun pa la sogs pa'i len par byed pa des gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ba ni / 'dun pa la sogs pa'i len par byed pa des gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: The phrase should be announced to the monks means that the monk who is the receiver of the announcement of the desire and so on should announce it to the elder of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: des drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong la tshe dang ldan pa dge slong ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par brjod do //🔽brjod pa gang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong la tshe dang ldan pa dge slong ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par brjod do // brjod pa gang rig par bgyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The elder monk should say to the monk who is sitting next to him, Venerable, announce the desire and the purity to the absent monks.🔽The phrase announce the announcement means that the elder monk should announce the announcement of the desire and so on to the absent monks.

original: kha cig las dge 'dun la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las dge 'dun la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some texts say to the saṅgha means

original: lugs kha cig las dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o zhes kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lugs kha cig las dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o zhes kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: that according to some traditions, the announcement should be made to the saṅgha.

original: btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol zhes bya bas brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol zhes bya bas brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase venerable, please consider means begin means

original: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsom pa rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsom pa rtsom pa'o //
translated: that the announcement of the desire and so on is the beginning of the rite.

original: btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba dang gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba dang gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase venerable, please consider and please listen means🔽that the announcement of the desire and so on is the beginning of the rite.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par dus byas sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par dus byas sam /
translated: If one dies before entering the Saṅgha,🔽or if one renounces the vows of a layperson, etc.,

original: khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i khas blangs na ma blangs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽'dun pa la sogs pa dbang du byas pas rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i khas blangs na ma blangs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni / 'dun pa la sogs pa dbang du byas pas rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: one is not a layperson.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bslab pa dbul ba'i tshig dag tu gtogs pa dge tshul nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bslab pa dbul ba'i tshig dag tu gtogs pa dge tshul nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the words of the novice monk, etc., up to the words of the fully ordained monk, which are included in the words of the precepts.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word “etc.” also refers to the words of the fully ordained monk, etc., up to the words of one who has caused blood to flow from the body of a Tathāgata with an evil thought, which are included in the words of the precepts.🔽Even if one does not understand that one becomes a layperson by accepting the precepts, one should have no doubt about this.

original: phyin na blangs pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar go bar ma byas su zin kyang 'di la the tshom med par bya'o zhes go bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yin pas dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs pa nyid /🔽dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pas de'i dngos po la 'dir gtso bo ste /
analyzed: phyin na blangs pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar go bar ma byas su zin kyang 'di la the tshom med par bya'o zhes go bar bya ba'i phyir brjod pa yin pas dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs pa nyid / dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pas de'i dngos po la 'dir gtso bo ste /
translated: The word “etc.” also refers to the words of the novice monk, etc., up to the words of the fully ordained monk, which are included in the words of the precepts.🔽The word “etc.” also refers to the words of the fully ordained monk, etc., up to the words of one who has caused blood to flow from the body of a Tathāgata with an evil thought, which are included in the words of the precepts.🔽Even if one does not understand that one becomes a layperson by accepting the precepts, one should have no doubt about this.

original: de bas na 'dir de shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here it is understood.

original: gzhan gyis tshes bco lnga la dge slong bzung na de la dge 'dun gyis 'di bdag cag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin gyi thong shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis tshes bco lnga la dge slong bzung na de la dge 'dun gyis 'di bdag cag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin gyi thong shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If a monk is arrested by others on the fifteenth day of the month, the Saṅgha should say to him, “Release him, because he is our fellow practitioner of pure conduct.”

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others refers to

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: kings and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brjod par bya'o //
translated: To him refers to the others who should be told.

original: gang gis dge slong bzung bar gyur pa de la mngon sum du'am 'phrin pa btang ste /
analyzed: gang gis dge slong bzung bar gyur pa de la mngon sum du'am 'phrin pa btang ste /
translated: If a monk is arrested, he should be released either in person or by messenger.

original: der rang gis sam thams cad kyis ma btang ba dang ma btang bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: der rang gis sam thams cad kyis ma btang ba dang ma btang bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If he is not released, he should not be released by himself or by all.

original: pho nya'i kha nas smra ba gang yin pa dang / rang gis kha nas smra ba gang yin pa 'di gnyis ka'i bsdu ba la dgongs nas /
analyzed: pho nya'i kha nas smra ba gang yin pa dang / rang gis kha nas smra ba gang yin pa 'di gnyis ka'i bsdu ba la dgongs nas /
translated: With the intention of including both what is said by a messenger and what is said by himself,

original: de ltar @78b nye bar btags pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar @78b nye bar btags pa'o /
translated: it is said thus.

original: ma btang na bdag cag 'di dang lhan cig bya ba cung zhig yod do zhes snga ma dang bcas te'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma btang na bdag cag 'di dang lhan cig bya ba cung zhig yod do zhes snga ma dang bcas te'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he is not released, he should be released together with the previous statement, “We have some business with him.”

original: snga ma dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni mdo snga ma des /
analyzed: snga ma dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni mdo snga ma des /
translated: The phrase along with the previous refers to the previous sūtra.

original: thong shig ces smos pa'i tsheg snga ma de dag dang bcas te /
analyzed: thong shig ces smos pa'i tsheg snga ma de dag dang bcas te /
translated: The phrase let go refers to the previous sūtra.

original: bdag cag dge slong 'di dang lhan cig bya ba cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar gzhan la brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag cag dge slong 'di dang lhan cig bya ba cung zad cig yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar gzhan la brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase we have some business with this monk means that you should say this to others.

original: de lta na yang dkyil 'khor par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang dkyil 'khor par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase even so, the community should be purified means

original: tshig gnyis pa brjod kyang ma btang na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyis dkyil 'khor du gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig gnyis pa brjod kyang ma btang na de'i tshe dge 'dun gyis dkyil 'khor du gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that even if you say the second phrase, if he is not released, then at that time the community should purify the poṣadha in a maṇḍala.

original: de btang ba'i phyir sngar mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de btang ba'i phyir sngar mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one should not make an effort to release him means

original: gzhan gyis bzung ba'i dge slong de btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bzung ba'i dge slong de btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that one should not make an effort to release that monk who is held by others.

original: 'phrigs pas / mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phrigs pas / mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase because of fear, there would be disagreement means🔽that if one makes an effort to release him, there would be disagreement.

original: mtshams kyi nang na dge slong dngos su 'khod par shes pa rnams kyi nges pa rnams kho nas dge slong rnams yod na /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na dge slong dngos su 'khod par shes pa rnams kyi nges pa rnams kho nas dge slong rnams yod na /
translated: The monks who are present in the midst of the boundary are the ones who are certain to come.

original: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa zhes pa las mi mthun pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa zhes pa las mi mthun pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there a fault due to the disagreement of those who are absent,

original: 'di ltar mthong ngam thos pas mi mthun pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba shas par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ngam thos pas mi mthun pa nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ba shas par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: but also there is a fault due to the disagreement of those who are seen or heard.

original: tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas mngon par brtags te las byed na nyes pa sbom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas mngon par brtags te las byed na nyes pa sbom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one imagines that the action is to be done by those who are absent, it is a serious transgression, because one desires their separateness.

original: tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Desiring their separateness means

original: nges pa'am 'phrigs pa ma lhags pa rnams tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas ma 'ongs kyang sla'o snyam du sems shing de bas na thag ring po na 'khod cig snyam pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'am 'phrigs pa ma lhags pa rnams tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pas ma 'ongs kyang sla'o snyam du sems shing de bas na thag ring po na 'khod cig snyam pa'o //
translated: that one thinks, “Even if those who are not certain or who are not informed desire separateness, it is all right,” and therefore they are far away.

original: 'dir las zhes smos pa'i 'dug par gtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i las su bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir las zhes smos pa'i 'dug par gtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i las su bya ba la /
translated: Here, the word “action” refers to the action that is to be done, which is included in the sitting and is in accordance with it.

original: tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de yongs su bcad pa'i don du tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de yongs su bcad pa'i don du tshig 'di'o //
translated: This phrase is for the purpose of excluding that which is not a member of the assembly.

original: 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la 'du ba'i skabs su dge 'dun lhag ma gang yin pa de'i skabs su tshogs pa'i nyes pa sdom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen la 'du ba'i skabs su dge 'dun lhag ma gang yin pa de'i skabs su tshogs pa'i nyes pa sdom por 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a summary of the faults of the assembly in the context of the remainder of the Saṅgha when there is a schism in the Saṅgha.

original: rtog pa nyid na the tshom za 'am nges par 'byed pa la ni nyes pa'i byed pa mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa nyid na the tshom za 'am nges par 'byed pa la ni nyes pa'i byed pa mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one is doubtful or when one is certain, the fault is not committed in the discernment.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /🔽ci gang dag ma lhags pa de dag med par bdag cag gis gsol ba byas te /🔽gso sbyong bya ba dang so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gdon du rung ngam 'on te mi rung /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni / ci gang dag ma lhags pa de dag med par bdag cag gis gsol ba byas te / gso sbyong bya ba dang so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa gdon du rung ngam 'on te mi rung /
translated: In this regard, the text is as follows:🔽“Should we do the invitation ceremony and recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra without those who are absent?🔽Or should we not?

original: de dag med par bdag cag gis dgag dbye byar rung @79a * //
analyzed: de dag med par bdag cag gis dgag dbye byar rung @79a * //
translated: Should we do the invitation ceremony without them?

original: dam 'on te mi rung snyam du rtog pa nyid na the tshom za'am nyes pa de dag med par bdag cag gis gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i bar dag byar rung ngo zhes nges par byed pa gang yin pa de la ni nyes pa'i byed pa mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dam 'on te mi rung snyam du rtog pa nyid na the tshom za'am nyes pa de dag med par bdag cag gis gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i bar dag byar rung ngo zhes nges par byed pa gang yin pa de la ni nyes pa'i byed pa mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks, “Is it proper or not?” and is uncertain, or if one thinks, “We should do the expiation and the invitation ceremony, because those faults do not exist,” then one is not free from the fault.

original: ji srid du 'don pa dang / dgag dbye byed pa'i bar dag tu mi mthun pa'i nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du 'don pa dang / dgag dbye byed pa'i bar dag tu mi mthun pa'i nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is said that as long as one does the expiation and the invitation ceremony, one will only incur the fault of disagreement.

original: de bzhin du 'dir 'di ni las thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa kho na yin pas spyir mdor byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir 'di ni las thams cad kyi dbang du byas pa kho na yin pas spyir mdor byas so //
translated: In the same way, here it is only in terms of all the actions that it is a general summary.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas yongs su btsal zhing go ba slob ma byas na dag pa'i byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas yongs su btsal zhing go ba slob ma byas na dag pa'i byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one has thoroughly investigated and understood it with a sincere mind, it is a pure action.

original: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa na dge slong dag 'byung bar shes nas gal te lhag pa'i bsam pas de rnams la slong bar byed na /
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa na dge slong dag 'byung bar shes nas gal te lhag pa'i bsam pas de rnams la slong bar byed na /
translated: If one knows that in the future there will be monks, and if one asks for them with a sincere motivation,

original: de nas 'di dag gcig pus ma thob pa las byed pas /
analyzed: de nas 'di dag gcig pus ma thob pa las byed pas /
translated: Then, since they are not satisfied with just that, they engage in activity.

original: de rnams la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / ma dag pa nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / ma dag pa nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are not free from the fault of being defiled and having something to be feared.🔽They do not seek to purify their activity by being satisfied with just what is proper, and not by being satisfied with what is improper.🔽They are not free from the fault of being in opposition to those who belong to that spiritual community.🔽They are not free from the fault of being in opposition to those who belong to that spiritual community.

original: rung ba tsam du gyur pa bsam pa thag pa nas ma yin pa yongs su btsal zhing dag pa'i byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba tsam du gyur pa bsam pa thag pa nas ma yin pa yongs su btsal zhing dag pa'i byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not free from the fault of being in opposition to those who belong to that spiritual community.

original: der gtogs pa rnams la mi mthun pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //🔽btsal ba dang / bod pa dang mthon par 'dug ste /🔽phyogs su blta ba dag gis ni de yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der gtogs pa rnams la mi mthun pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro // btsal ba dang / bod pa dang mthon par 'dug ste / phyogs su blta ba dag gis ni de yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not free from the fault of being in opposition to those who belong to that spiritual community.

original: rnam pa de gsum gyi rigs kyis ni yongs su btsal ba nyid yin te /🔽de 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum gyi rigs kyis ni yongs su btsal ba nyid yin te / de 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'dir btsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs de dang de rnams su byul ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir btsal ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs de dang de rnams su byul ba'o //
translated: They are not free from the fault of being in opposition to those who belong to that spiritual community.

original: bod pa zhes bya ba ni skad kyis bod pa'o //
analyzed: bod pa zhes bya ba ni skad kyis bod pa'o //
translated: They are not free from

original: mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs mthon por 'greng ste mig rgyang gis phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs mthon por 'greng ste mig rgyang gis phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Standing in a high place and looking in the directions means: standing in a high place, one should look in the directions with the eyes.

original: de gsum la yang go rims bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: de gsum la yang go rims bzhin du bya ste /
translated: These three are to be done in order.

original: dang po rjes su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po rjes su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: First, one should search.

original: btsal bas ma rnyed na bod par bya'o //
analyzed: btsal bas ma rnyed na bod par bya'o //
translated: If one does not find it by searching, one should ask.

original: des kyang ma rnyed na phyogs ches mthon por 'greng ste /
analyzed: des kyang ma rnyed na phyogs ches mthon por 'greng ste /
translated: If one does not find it by asking, one should stand in a very high place

original: phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
translated: and look in the four directions.

original: de bzhin du 'dir 'di 'jug par rigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir 'di 'jug par rigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: In the same way, here it is the nature of what is reasonable to engage in.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam pa gnyis dag la ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam pa gnyis dag la ste /
translated: Here, the text is about two types:

original: ji skad du zhu ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du zhu ba las /
translated: As it says in the Questions of Sagaramati Sutra:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong grong mtha' ba ma lags pa dgon pa na gnas pa de rnams thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas gcig @79b tu 'du bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong grong mtha' ba ma lags pa dgon pa na gnas pa de rnams thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas gcig @79b tu 'du bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One has said, Those monks who are not on the outskirts of the village but dwelling in the wilderness, all of them should gather in one place for the poṣadha.

original: gal te de rnams mi gda' na bcal bar bgyi zhing gal te de rnams ma rnyed na bod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gal te de rnams mi gda' na bcal bar bgyi zhing gal te de rnams ma rnyed na bod par bgyi'o //
translated: If they are not there, one should look for them. If one does not find them, one should ask.

original: gal te de rnams kyis ma mthos na gso sbyong bgyi'o zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: gal te de rnams kyis ma mthos na gso sbyong bgyi'o zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: If they do not see them, they should say, “We will perform the poṣadha.”

original: nye bar 'khor byas zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dag /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor byas zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dag /
translated: Or, Upāli, they should say, “We have done it.”
