translated: One should not rise from meditative concentration. This is the text of the analysis here and of the later sūtra.

original: gdams ngag med par bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag ston pa po med par bsgom par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdams ngag med par bsgom par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag ston pa po med par bsgom par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not meditate without instruction. This means one should not meditate without a teacher of instruction.

original: gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor ba rigs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor ba rigs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The application of the analogy of the potter and the balloon is correct.

original: rtsa ba'i gzhi las 'di'i tshig gang yin ba de ni ngan par 'gro bar gyur pa 'di yod pa dang / rtse bar gyur pa la yang ma yin zhes rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gzhi las 'di'i tshig gang yin ba de ni ngan par 'gro bar gyur pa 'di yod pa dang / rtse bar gyur pa la yang ma yin zhes rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di'o //
translated: This sūtra is taught for the purpose of showing that from the root text, one should not understand that “whatever words there are here, they are for this one who has gone to a bad rebirth, and also for one who is playing.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: phran tshegs kyi mdo phyi ma dag las /
analyzed: phran tshegs kyi mdo phyi ma dag las /
translated: In the later Kṣudraka-āgama sūtras,🔽it says:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na ji ltar chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi dogs kyi dge slong dag @85b gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa de ltar gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba phyi ma las kyang dge slong gis
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na ji ltar chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi dogs kyi dge slong dag @85b gis brtson 'grus brtsams pa de ltar gdos bu dang pho long gi sbyor bas brtson 'grus brtsam par bya'o zhes bya ba phyi ma las kyang dge slong gis
translated: Monks, therefore, just as the monks on the bank of the Manohara River exerted themselves, you should exert yourselves with the application of a log and a water pot.

original: brtson 'grus glod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus glod par mi bya'o //
translated: Monks should not relax their effort.

original: brtson 'grus glod par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus glod par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If they relax their effort, they are in contradiction.

original: gang du 'di las 'og tu gzhung ma bshad pa der yang gzhung 'di phran tshegs dag las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du 'di las 'og tu gzhung ma bshad pa der yang gzhung 'di phran tshegs dag las rig par bya'o //
translated: In those places where this passage is not explained in the text, it should be known from the Ksudraka Collection.

original: brtson 'grus glod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus glod par mi bya'o //
translated: Monks should not relax their effort.

original: 'di ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong nyin mo 'dug pa dang 'chag pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing mtshan mo'i thun dang po la 'dug pa dang 'chag pa dag
analyzed: 'di ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong nyin mo 'dug pa dang 'chag pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing mtshan mo'i thun dang po la 'dug pa dang 'chag pa dag
translated: During the first part of the night, they purify their minds of obscurations through sitting and walking.

original: gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing nam gyi gung thun lag gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang du zhugs te /
analyzed: gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing nam gyi gung thun lag gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang du zhugs te /
translated: In the middle part of the night, they wash their feet outside the temple, enter the temple,

original: glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag nas snang ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas dbugs dbyung ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes su byed cing /
analyzed: glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag nas snang ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pas dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas dbugs dbyung ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes su byed cing /
translated: lie down on their right sides, place their feet one on top of the other, and with the perception of light, mindfulness and introspection, they think, “I will not exhale.”

original: de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la myur ba myur bar rab tu sad nas 'dug pa dang / 'chag pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la myur ba myur bar rab tu sad nas 'dug pa dang / 'chag pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: He quickly awakens in the last part of the night and, sitting or pacing back and forth, he purifies his mind of the obscurations.

original: de tsam gyis dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro //🔽de tsam gyis yang de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams par shes pa nas gang du bka' bsgo ba zhes gang zhig mdo sde las brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes 'dir rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams par 'gyur ro // de tsam gyis yang de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong brtson 'grus brtsams par shes pa nas gang du bka' bsgo ba zhes gang zhig mdo sde las brtson 'grus dang ldan pa zhes 'dir rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: To that extent, a monk is said to have begun his effort.🔽To that extent, the Tathāgata knows that monk to have begun his effort.

original: 'dir nyal ba la ma mo las lhag par 'don pa de 'di bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nyal ba la ma mo las lhag par 'don pa de 'di bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the recitation of the mother sūtras in excess of the recitation of the mother sūtras is to be included.

original: lus dang sems dang gos ma 'phyar bar nyal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dang gos dag re re la mi 'phyar bar zhes so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems dang gos ma 'phyar bar nyal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dang gos dag re re la mi 'phyar bar zhes so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should lie down without tossing the body, mind, or robes. This means that one should not toss the body, mind, or robes individually.

original: mi na bas nyin mo nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi na bas nyin mo nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who is not sick should not sleep during the day.

original: 'dir ngal ba yang na ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ngal ba yang na ba ste /
translated: Here, “tired” means “sick.”

original: lus nyam chung bar zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: lus nyam chung bar zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The commentary explains that “weak” means “with a weak body.”

original: dang dag de'i bar du gnyid kyis snyom pa brnags mi thub pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: dang dag de'i bar du gnyid kyis snyom pa brnags mi thub pa nyid yin na /
translated: If one is unable to overcome the heaviness of sleep,

original: gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba'i phyir des de tsam zhig bsten par bya zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i gzhi la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyi snyom pa bsang ba'i phyir des de tsam zhig bsten par bya zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i gzhi la shes par bya'o //
translated: one should rely on that much in order to dispel the heaviness of sleep. This should be understood in the context of the root text.

original: zas kyis snyom pa brnags mi bzod pa zhig yin @86a * //
analyzed: zas kyis snyom pa brnags mi bzod pa zhig yin @86a * //
translated: If one is unable to overcome the heaviness of food,

original: na yang de bsang ba'i phyir de tsam zhig bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: na yang de bsang ba'i phyir de tsam zhig bsten par bya'o //
translated: one should rely on that much in order to dispel it.

original: 'di la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is so in this case as well.

original: mdo sde las kyang mer 'jug gi bus ni dpyid rnams kyi zla ba tha ma la yud tsam zhig zad kyis snyom pa bsang bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang mer 'jug gi bus ni dpyid rnams kyi zla ba tha ma la yud tsam zhig zad kyis snyom pa bsang bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sutras also say that Maudgalyayana dispelled the heaviness of sleep for a moment in the last month of spring.

original: ro rgyab na bas pus 'khyud bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro rgyab na bas pus 'khyud bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One who is sick should hold his knees with his hands.

original: dbang po rnams nang du bsdus pa dang / yid phyi rol du ma song ba dang / gsal ba dang drang pos mi thogs par bcag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po rnams nang du bsdus pa dang / yid phyi rol du ma song ba dang / gsal ba dang drang pos mi thogs par bcag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should break them with the faculties withdrawn inward, with the mind not going outside, and with clarity and uprightness.

original: phyi rol du ma song ba'i zhes bya ba ni yul rnams la ma song ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du ma song ba'i zhes bya ba ni yul rnams la ma song ba ste /
translated: Not going outside means not going to the objects.

original: kha phyir phyogs pa nyid kyis phyir 'gro ba 'di la phyi rol du 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can sa'i dbyings la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang 'dir yul yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha phyir phyogs pa nyid kyis phyir 'gro ba 'di la phyi rol du 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can sa'i dbyings la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang 'dir yul yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it faces outward, it goes outside. Here, the earth element, etc., should be known as objects, having the nature of going outside.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni sems dang ba dang rab tu zin pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni sems dang ba dang rab tu zin pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: Clarity means with a clear mind and a well-controlled body.

original: drang por zhes bya ba ni gom pa ya yo med pas so //
analyzed: drang por zhes bya ba ni gom pa ya yo med pas so //
translated: Upright means without limping.

original: mi nus na tha gu brel te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus na tha gu brel te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one cannot, one should break them with a rope.

original: drang por 'chag mi nus na tha gu sbrel te bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: drang por 'chag mi nus na tha gu sbrel te bcag par bya'o //
translated: If one cannot walk upright, one should break them while tied with a rope.

original: kha ton pa'i 'chags ni khru bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: kha ton pa'i 'chags ni khru bcu gnyis so //
translated: The walking of reciters is twelve cubits.

original: spong ba pa ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: spong ba pa ni bco brgyad do //
translated: The walking of abandoners is eighteen.

original: de tha gus gzhal te bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de tha gus gzhal te bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be measured with a cubit.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa'o //
translated: Here, “it” refers to the walking path.

original: dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: In the Bhikṣuṇī Vibhāṣā,

original: 'dir gzhung ni bslab pa'i gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bslab pa'i gzhi las /
translated: the text of the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya says,

original: de dag gis 'chag pa ji lta bu mi shes nas /
analyzed: de dag gis 'chag pa ji lta bu mi shes nas /
translated: “They do not know how to make the walking path.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: spong pa'i sa ni khru bco brgyad do //
analyzed: spong pa'i sa ni khru bco brgyad do //
translated: “The place of abandonment is eighteen cubits.

original: kha ton byed pa ni khru bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: kha ton byed pa ni khru bcu gnyis te /
translated: The place for recitation is twelve cubits.

original: de dag tha gus gzhal te bcag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag tha gus gzhal te bcag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They should be measured with a cubit and made.”

original: tha gus gzhal te bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las /
analyzed: tha gus gzhal te bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa las /
translated: “Measured with a cubit” is explained in the commentary:

original: gzhan 'dir rang dang gzhan dag la rigs dag pa gzhag pa rnam pa gang zhig chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'dir rang dang gzhan dag la rigs dag pa gzhag pa rnam pa gang zhig chos bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the presentation of one’s own and others’ lineages is a type of teaching the Dharma.

original: gso sbyong gi nyi ma la bya ba nyid 'di la yod de de bas na 'dir gtogs pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi nyi ma la bya ba nyid 'di la yod de de bas na 'dir gtogs pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is the procedure on the poṣadha day, so the ritual belonging to that should be explained.

original: dge slong gis chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gis chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A monk should explain the Dharma” means

original: 'dir thog mar byas pa'i ngag cung zad ces bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thog mar byas pa'i ngag cung zad ces bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Here, first, the word a little at the end of speech is the final.

original: 'di thog ma zhes bya ba ni rgan po'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thog ma zhes bya ba ni rgan po'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, first is the final of old.🔽By that is the final of fifteenth. By the form of half a month is the final of discard.

original: des tshes bco lnga zhes bya ba'i mthar zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: des tshes bco lnga zhes bya ba'i mthar zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here, the text is from the Vibhāṣā.

original: 'dir nyar byed pa zhes bya ba phran tshegs rnams las so //
analyzed: 'dir nyar byed pa zhes bya ba phran tshegs rnams las so //
translated: Here, the one who is taken is from the Kṣudraka-āgama.

original: gal te ma bskul bar de'i sgo nas nges par 'byung @86b ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rab tu byung ba'i gzhi las so //
analyzed: gal te ma bskul bar de'i sgo nas nges par 'byung @86b ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di rab tu byung ba'i gzhi las so //
translated: If one does not go forth without being urged, by that is from the Foundation of Going Forth.

original: 'dir lhag ma gang zhig byed pa mtshams sbyar ba mtha'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: 'dir lhag ma gang zhig byed pa mtshams sbyar ba mtha'i rnam pas so //
translated: Here, what is the remainder that is to be done? By the form of the end of the connection.

original: de la ma mo 'dug ste'o //
analyzed: de la ma mo 'dug ste'o //
translated: There, the mother sits.

original: gal te du ma nyid yin na gcig gis so zhes bya ba ni gal te chos ston pa du ma nyid yod na 'di pa'i dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te du ma nyid yin na gcig gis so zhes bya ba ni gal te chos ston pa du ma nyid yod na 'di pa'i dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: If there are many, then by one. If there are many who teach the Dharma, then those who belong to the retinue of monks of this teaching are understood by implication.

original: chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba thams cad la mtshan tha dad pa la yang sdom pa mchog dang mchog ma yin pa la chos 'di pa'i dge sbyong gi 'khor du gtogs pa zhes bya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba thams cad la mtshan tha dad pa la yang sdom pa mchog dang mchog ma yin pa la chos 'di pa'i dge sbyong gi 'khor du gtogs pa zhes bya ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all those who have gone forth in this teaching, even if they have different names, are included in the retinue of monks of this teaching, whether they are superior or not.

original: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This procedure is also established for those who have gone forth but have not yet completed the novitiate.

original: gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba ni gsar bu dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag gis kyang byar rung ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba ni gsar bu dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag gis kyang byar rung ste /
translated: By any one means that it is suitable for a novice, one who does not have the characteristics, or one who has gone forth but has not completed the novitiate.

original: rgan po 'ba' zhig gis ni bya bar ma zad de bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgan po 'ba' zhig gis ni bya bar ma zad de bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not only an elder who should perform it, but one who has completed the novitiate, this is the meaning.

original: de dag gi nang na chos ston pa du ma yod du zin kyang gang la ston par byed pa thams cad ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi nang na chos ston pa du ma yod du zin kyang gang la ston par byed pa thams cad ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although there are many who teach the Dharma among them, the meaning is that one should not teach to just anyone.

original: ma gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not teach without being asked means one should not teach without being requested.

original: gal te de'i tshe tshig gis byung ba ma yin na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe tshig gis byung ba ma yin na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not speak at that time, means

original: gang gi tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa la sogs pa ma gsol bar yang chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshig gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa la sogs pa ma gsol bar yang chos bstan par bya ste /
translated: if one does not speak the words by which the Saṅgha is invited, etc., then one should teach the Dharma without being asked.

original: ston pa da bzhin du 'dir 'di 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ston pa da bzhin du 'dir 'di 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The same principle applies here.

original: 'di ltar mdun gyis bltas par gyur pas mdun gyis bltas pa nyid de dge slong de rnams dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdun gyis bltas par gyur pas mdun gyis bltas pa nyid de dge slong de rnams dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Since they face the front, they are called those who face the front. They are in harmony with those monks.

original: 'dir 'byung ba ni dpe tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba ni dpe tsam yin te /
translated: Here, the example is merely illustrative.

original: thams cad du de'i sgo nas gnas pa la chog 'di yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du de'i sgo nas gnas pa la chog 'di yin no //
translated: This is the rule for all who live in that way.

original: gnas skabs thams cad la yang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi tshig las gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad la yang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi tshig las gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And in all circumstances, one should understand that it is the duty of the Saṅgha’s most senior monk.

original: gnas pa la ni gnas kyi'o //🔽nye gnas rnams la ni klog pa'i slob dpon gyi'o //
analyzed: gnas pa la ni gnas kyi'o // nye gnas rnams la ni klog pa'i slob dpon gyi'o //
translated: The teacher of the Abhidharma is the most venerable of those who are teachers.🔽The teacher of the Vinaya is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Abhidharma.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Vinaya.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Vinaya.

original: dge slong ma rnams la dge slong rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams la dge slong rnams kyi'o //
translated: The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.

analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs shing rab tu byung ba rnams la ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ste gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.

original: gsar bu la kha zas kyi mdun du yon bshad pa'i don du khri'i drung du de ni ma gsol bar shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsar bu la kha zas kyi mdun du yon bshad pa'i don du khri'i drung du de ni ma gsol bar shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.🔽The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.

original: grvas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gral bcings pa'i dbyibs dang lang long khyad par can ma yin par gyur pas 'khor lhag ma'o //
analyzed: grvas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gral bcings pa'i dbyibs dang lang long khyad par can ma yin par gyur pas 'khor lhag ma'o //
translated: The teacher of the Sutras is the most venerable of those who are teachers of the Sutras.

original: 'dir de'i mthar thug pa yin te /
